IF THERE'S ANYONE IN THERE WITH YOU, SEND
PLEASE REMAIN CALM. WE ARE SLOWING THE
EVERYONE, PLEASE CLEAR THE STREETS. WE
YOUR POLICIES AND YOUR WAYS OF VIOLENCE-
FROM THIS MINUTE ON--I WILL BE WATCHING.
FROM THIS MINUTE ON, YOU SHALL CHANGE
LOOK, I'M SORRY. YOU'VE LEFT US NO
WAY TO THE ROOF AND I'LL EXTEND A RAMP TO
ANY NATION THAT DOES NOT IMMEDIATELY
I AM DISAPPOINTED IN YOU ADRIAN. VERY
FIRE DOWN FROM BELOW. CALMLY MAKE YOUR
ARE TRYING TO RETAIN ORDER UNTIL THE
THIS IS DR. MANHATTAN. FOR YEARS, I HAVE
LET'S MAKE THIS A NICE, CLEAN SURRENDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A "Have A Nice Day" HAPPY FACE PIN. STEAM rises past the pin. We hear a KETTLE BOILING. We PULL BACK and find that the pin adorns the lapel of a worn by EDWARD BLAKE, 63, but amazingly not far from his physical prime--body chiseled, built like a truck. Handso too, save the LONG SCAR running down the side of his face Blake removes the kettle from the stove. He scoops some A tea leaves from a can, dumps them in a cup .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is expensive but not quite luxurious. Terri New York view from the window. Blake lives well, if alone sits on the couch with his cup of, tea, puts his feet up. the remote, turns the big screen TV on. The news:

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: --addressing the United Nations today, the President expressed his concern over the increasingly intense territorial disputes in both Asia and the Middle East. CUT TO: The PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES--

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: The sound of a bullet at one end of the world echoes across the ocean to the other end. Armed conflict is not self contained in its respective region--the consequences reverberate through every nation across the world and therefore must be avoided at all costs. CUT BACK TO: The Anchorwoman--

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: While the President's position was clear, he did not comment on whether or not he would order Dr. Manhattan into action should the situation continue to escalate. CUT TO: Stock footage of DR. MANHATTAN--a man, at least h appears to be, who has glowing blue skin. The stock foota shows Dr. Manhattan flying through the air as a MISSILE h straight for him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With a wave of his hand, Dr. Manhattan stops the missile its flight--frozen in mid-air--inches from his face. With another wave, Dr. Manhattan DETONATES the missile. D Manhattan disappears in the EXPLOSION . but once the smoke clears, we see he's still there. Unscathed-- --Blake snorts at the stock footage, changes the channel- CRASH!--The FRONT DOOR EXPLODES, splintered by a KICK; Bl jumps up, immediately at the ready-- --when we see the INTRUDER'S FEET entering. Slowly. Blake sees the Intruder's face, though we never do--we only see that he's dressed in ALL BLACK, including GLOVES and a KN HAT. A look of recognition comes over Blake.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Just a matter of time, I suppose. With sudden, blinding speed, Blake WHIPS the SAUCER from under his cup, sending it FLYING like a saw-blade. The Intruder BATS IT out of the air with even quicker reflexe but the act buys Blake time to pull a PISTOL with a SILEN from a hollowed out STEREO SPEAKER. He's a pro . but so is our Intruder. Before Blake can get a shot off, the Intruder is already upon him, SNATCHING the gun of Blake's hand-- --Blake PUNCHES the Intruder in the chest plate--the Intr drops the gun. Blake fights. Not like an old man, but lik the trained killer he is. But the Intruder is much, much faster. Younger. Deadlier. He SMASHES Blake with an elbow the head. Blake falls. BLOOD blurs his vision. The Intruder picks B up off the ground. Brings him to the window with the grea New York view. Thirty stories up. Blake looks the Intrude the eye . and starts laughing. Hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I always thought I knew the punchline. But I guess the joke's on me now. He laughs. The INTRUDER seems to regard Blake a moment-- --then, with incredible strength, he LIFTS BLAKE OVER HIS HEAD AND THROWS BLAKE THROUGH THE WINDOW. Blake never mak sound as he plummets to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Blake's dead body. His eyes are wide open, not fear, but in resignation. As BLOOD starts to POOL behind head, we move to the happy face pin Blake wore, now on th sidewalk by his neck. We slowly ZOOM IN on the pin as blo DRIPS on it . when the pin is WASHED AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOPKEEPER has his HOSE out, spraying off the blood fro the sidewalk. Blake's body is gone, a CHALK OUTLINE in it place. A COP comes running up to the Shopkeeper.

dialogues.speaker: COP 1
dialogues.text: Hey! This is still a goddamn crime scene!

dialogues.speaker: SHOPKEEPER
dialogues.text: It's been over four hours, I got a business to run-- As they argue, we're back following the happy face pin, a the water carries it to a DRAIN-- --when someone picks the pin up. We're in this person's P as he studies the pin for a moment before pocketing it. We never see his face. We move from his POV-- --to across the street, arriving at a NEWS STAND. People the news stand stare at. the crime scene. At the cop stil arguing with the shopkeeper, the patrol cars, the yellow tape. At the MEDICAL EXAMINER zipping up Blake's BODY BAG Other people at the news stand ignore the scene and perus the magazines and periodicals, most of which have inflammatory headlines regarding the tense atmosphere currently in the world--a Newsweek headline reads "War?", New York Times: "China Moves Battleships near Taiwanese Waters," The New York Post, over a PHOTO of the President with Dr. Manhattan: "What Me Worry?" The NEWS VENDOR notices a MAN frowning at the papers.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS VENDOR
dialogues.text: (re: headlines) Depressing ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: But good for business, right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEWS VENDOR
dialogues.text: Yeah. Irony's a bitch. The man pays for a newspaper when A HOMELESS MAN taps the News Vendor on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: The current issue of The New Frontiersman, where is it?

dialogues.speaker: NEWS VENDOR
dialogues.text: It's late this month.

dialogues.speaker: HOMELESS MAN
dialogues.text: When will it be here?

dialogues.speaker: NEWS VENDOR
dialogues.text: I dunno, pal, like I said, it's late-- We MOVE BACK ACROSS THE STREET, to Blake's apartment building, then MOVE UP the building, to the broken glass window Blake was thrown out of. We MOVE INTO THE WINDOW--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --inside the apartment, where DET. GALLAGHER (older, jade and DET. FINE (street worn, but not quite cynical yet) wa through the crime scene. Fine studies the broken window.

dialogues.speaker: DET. FINE
dialogues.text: Edward Blake--63 years old, six-two, 225. A solid 225, guy was built like a linebacker. This is plate glass too, you'd have to step on the gas just to put a crack in this. Had to be a two man job. At least. You check the bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: DET. GALLAGHER
dialogues.text: Drawers were open, tossed through. Mattress flipped.

dialogues.speaker: DET. FINE
dialogues.text: Robbery?

dialogues.speaker: DET. GALLAGHER
dialogues.text: Or made to look like one. (tosses Fine an ID) Found that in the bedroom. Det. Fine studies it. It's Blake's UNITED NATIONS ID. It reads "Special Advisor, United States." (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DET. GALLAGHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see this? He picks up a PHOTO from the floor, hands it to Fine.

dialogues.speaker: DET. GALLAGHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shaking hands with the President.

dialogues.speaker: DET. FINE
dialogues.text: You're saying this guy was a spook? You think this might be a political murder?

dialogues.speaker: DET. GALLAGHER
dialogues.text: I think that this is way bigger than the both of us. He leaves Det. Fine to ponder this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside Blake's apartment building. It's later now, the n stand is closed, businesses closed, people gone. We move into someone's POV. The person stares up at the broken window of Blake's apartment, now covered with PLAS SHEETING.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rorschach's Journal, October 12th. Earlier today I came across what appeared to be a suicide. It was later learned to be a homicide. Someone's time was up. Still in POV, we see the person pull something from his pocket--the happy face pin. We realize that this was the person whose POV we were in earlier.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I discovered a clue. Something I recognized. And suddenly, unexpectedly . I heard my own clock ticking. We move out of the POV and see our guy for the first time RORSCHACH (roar-shock)--a masked vigilante who wears a tr coat, fedora, and a silver-white MASK with oily BLACK SPO moving about, creating shifting, doubled PATTERNS like a Rorschach test. Scary looking. Rorschach draws a hydraulic GRAPPLING GUN from his coat, FIRES the HOOK AND CABLE THIRTY STORIES UP where it latch itself through Blake's broken window. Pressing RETRACT, Rorschach FLIES UP THE WALL to the 30th floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a grunt, Rorschach pulls himself past the plastic sheeting, through the window, and into Blake's apartment. investigates, silent. He sees the same things that the co saw . . but he notices the speakers by the TV. Notices on of the speaker covers is ever so slightly askew. Rorschach pulls the speaker cover off and discovers that speaker was hollow. (The Intruder clearly took Blake's gu and put the cover back on when he left. Why?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake's clothing hangs in military rows. Rorschach runs h fingers along the wall-seams. He pauses, presses on the hanger BAR, which SLIDES BACK to reveal a RED BUTTON. Pressing it, the BACK WALL of the closet SLIDES OPEN, revealing a SECRET COMPARTMENT. On the wall is an old FRA PHOTO of EIGHT PEOPLE IN COSTUMES, from the 60s. Included this photo is a young Edward Blake--Blake wasn't a spook- was a superhero. WEAPONS of all kinds adorn the walls in here. TEAR-GAS, GRENADES, RIFLES, PISTOLS--if it can kill you Blake's got But that's not what draws Rorschach's attention. Hanging on the back wall, dead center, is a more current COSTUME. Black leather armor, gloves, boots. Hanging over all like a vacant, grinning face--a black leather MASK. Rorschach stares. Framed nearby is the FRONT PAGE OF THE BOSTON GLOBE. The headline reads "The Comedian Gets Last Laugh On Moloch." Underneath is a photo of Blake dressed the costume Rorschach was staring at--Blake was a superhe called the Comedian. In the photo, Blake holds a supervil named MOLOCH prisoner. (We'll meet Moloch later.) On the same page is a smaller photo of a group of superheroes. Rorschach is in the photo, as is Dr. Manhatt as is the Comedian. (As are DAN DREIBERG, ADRIAN VEIDT, a LAURIE JUPITER, all of whom we'll be meeting soon). The caption below reads: "The New Watchmen." Suddenly, Rorschach hears the front door open. He quickly closes the secret hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two uniformed COPS stand in the doorway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COP 1
dialogues.text: You sure it wasn't the wind?

dialogues.speaker: COP 2
dialogues.text: Nah, I definitely heard something.

dialogues.speaker: COP 1
dialogues.text: I tell ya, I'd rather do traffic duty than be posted at a crime scene all night. Watch the door. Cop 1 pulls his gun, going through the motions rather tha being concerned. He then enters the bedroom. Cop 2 stands guard, nervous From the bedroom:

dialogues.speaker: COP 1, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Clear! I'm checking the other rooms. Cop 2 relaxes a bit, turns-- --and comes face to "face" with Rorschach, standing inche away. The Cop's face goes slack with childish terror. He to yell but Rorschach raises two fingers, "Shhh"-- The fingers JAB INTO THE COP'S WINDPIPE. The cop HISSES a falls silently as Rorschach brushes past him like a whisp

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: See, the Comedian thought he had it all worked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A FRAMED PHOTO of the first Watchmen--identical the old one in Blake's closet. Holding the photo is HOLLI MASON. He puts the photo down, but we don't see his face

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He was young and arrogant, but what he lacked in experience, he made up for in . tenacity. As he speaks, we PAN ACROSS various FRAMED MEMORABILIA: T first is a NEWSPAPER CLIPPING dated 1958: MYSTERIOUS MASK MAN CLEANS UP WHARFS--the caption underneath reads "Hero Calls Himself The Nite Owl."

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Guess I was that way too, when I started. I'll never know what possessed me to put that mask on the first time. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It started with the villains, y'know, people forget that. Pirate outfits, ghosts. Gangs that thought it was funny to dress up and pull heists, crap like that. PAN ACROSS: Another FRAMED CLIPPING, dated 1962: NITE OWL FORMS WATCHMEN--COSTUMED HEROES COMBINING FORCES! "'We're going to clean up this town!' Says costumed crusader."

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: So a few cops, we decide it might be funny to mask up too. Be anonymous. Take these guys on at the street level, right? Then the media got wind, ran with it, turned it into a whole different beast. PAN ACROSS: A GOLD STATUE of NITE OWL in his Sixties-era costume. The plaque below reads: IN GRATITUDE, 1969. Anot clipping: "Hero Retires, Reveals Identity In Tell All Boo Finally, we come to HOLLIS MASON (aka Nite Owl), 70s, tho his eyes sparkle with strength and his face still shows t edges of a born hero. The TV is on in the background.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Superheroes, Supervillians--you know who I ran into the other day at the market? The Screaming Skull. We chatted for a while. Turns out he's a born again.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No way. We see who Hollis is speaking to--DAN DREIBERG (the secon Nite Owl), late 30's, handsome, though he's let himself g the past few years--his edges have gone soft. He was in t photo of the new Watchmen in Blake's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: All the nuts that started popping up, I'll tell ya. Who was that midget you and your partner chased down years ago? What'd he call himself?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The Big Figure.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Big Figure. A midget bad guy. Guess it doesn't get lower than that, does it? Hollis laughs at his own joke; Dan chuckles, polite. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (glances at his watch) Wow, it's really late. Dan stands, finishes his beer. Hollis sees him to the doo

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Well, even though I spent my time catching real bad guys, you were still a better Nite Owl than I ever was.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That's bullshit, Hollis, and you know it. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: With all this talk of war, all that's going on in the world, it's a shame the government forced all you guys out. Before Dan can answer he notices a breaking news report o the TV:

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: This just in--masked vigilante Rorschach has assaulted a New York City police officer who was guarding a crime scene in the early morning hours. Rorschach is on the FBIs ten most wanted list for violation of the Keene Act, which banned masked heroes ten years ago. Dan and Hollis watch as an image of Rorschach flashes on screen.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: Well, forced all of you guys out except one. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week? Dan nods, then leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan descends the stairs. He pulls up his collar against t cold and walks down an alley. A SIGN below Hollis' apartm reads: "MASON AUTO REPAIRS--Obsolete models a specialty!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan rides the subway, lost in thought, when a group of GA MEMBERS, wearing yellow and black BANDANAS brush past him ONE stops. Dan's leg is out, a couple inches too far.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: Move your leg.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: I said move, dick. Dan finally realizes what he's talking about. Dan meets h eyes, for just a moment and draws back his leg. The Gang Members snicker at Dan as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan walks down the empty street to his TOWNHOUSE, digging his keys. Then he stops, suddenly alert. His front door hangs slightly OPEN--the LOCK'S been SMASH There's a LIGHT on inside. Cautious, Dan enters the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan quietly approaches the light coming from his kitchen. hears odd, metal scraping SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan enters the kitchen, stunned to find--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach. Rorschach sits at the table, mask half up, eating a cold OF BEANS.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Hello Daniel. I helped myself to some beans. You don't mind?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No, of course not. You uh, want me to heat some up for you?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: No need. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rorschach finishes the can of beans, stands, pulls his ma back down. There's a strong familiarity between the two b at the same time, Dan is wary.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You were on the news. They say you attacked a cop.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Minor wound. Won't need hospitalization.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Other than that . How have you been keeping?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Out of prison. So far. Look at this. He tosses Blake's happy face pin onto the table. Dan pick up, runs his fingers over the RED-BROWN SPLOTCH.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: This little stain, is that bean juice or--

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Human bean juice. It belonged to the Comedian. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The Comedian? Nervous now, Dan glances out the window. DAN (cont'd) Let's talk downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach follows Dan to a CLOSET, at the end of the hall Dan opens the closet, revealing an old BOOKSHELF. With so difficulty, Dan PULLS OPEN the HINGED BOOKSHELF with a RU CREAK. STEEL STAIRS lead down into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men descend into Dan's WORKSHOP--the dusty remnan of a hero's LAB; Old computers and an OWL-COSTUME, hangin a locker. No-one has been down here for years. In the cen of the space, an OVAL VEHICLE the size of a subway car is covered by a dusty TARP--the Owl-Ship.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How did it happen? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Murder. Someone threw him out a window.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Maybe it was a burglary. The killer might not have known who Blake was.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: An ordinary burglar? Kill the Comedian? Ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're right. I heard he was working for the government. Maybe it was a political killing.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Maybe. Or maybe someone's decided to kill off costumed heroes.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You don't think that's . a little paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Is that what they're saying about me now? That I'm paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I-'m just saying the Comedian made a lot of enemies over the years, even amongst his friends, if he had any. The man wasn't exactly endearing. Just because something happened to him doesn't mean it involves us.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: One of our own has been murdered. I thought you might be interested. An attack on one is an attack on all of us, right? Dan hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm out, Rorschach. I've been out, we've all been out. Except you. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Yes. I know that. Anyways, I thought I'd let you know. Just in case. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. You can take the tunnel out to the warehouse on Fleet street-- Rorschach turns to walk off down a long, dark TUNNEL.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: I remember. Used to come here a lot. Back when we were partners.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Those were good times, Rorschach. Great times. (more to himself) What ever happened to them?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: You quit. Rorschach disappears into the SUBWAY TUNNEL, leaving Dan reminisce alone. Dan glances at his old costume hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kind of room you rent by the hour. Or the minute even cheap looking HOOKER enters with an ARMY OFFICER, gigglin She playfully pushes the Officer onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: So tell me what you wanna do. Sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARMY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Seeing that I don't have to be back to base till Friday--everything. He puts a stack of BILLS on the dresser. Then takes his UNIFORM off like he can't wait. The Hooker gets on top of --when the DOOR FLIES OFF THE HINGES. Rorschach steps in, yanks the Hooker off-- --the officer gets to his feet, throws a punch, which Rorschach dodges. Rorschach GRABS the guy's arm, then KIC the Officer on the side of his KNEE, tearing the joint to shreds. The Officer cries out in pain, falls to the floor Rorschach nails him in the head with a BLACK JACK, knocki him out. The Hooker screams. Rorschach grabs her by the hair and S her face into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Quiet, whore. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nose broken and bleeding, the Hooker quiets to a whimper. Rorschach takes the officer's uniform and ID. Then leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mammoth, shining skyscraper. At the 50th-floor there is HUGE V-SHAPED HOLE where WATER FALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mammoth lobby. The decor is Egyptian and marble. Dan approaches a beautiful ASSISTANT behind an imposing desk.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Adrian Veidt.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No, uh, just tell him Dan Dreiberg is here to see him.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Veidt doesn't see anyone without an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I understand, but if you would just tell Adrian that Dan Dreiberg is here, I'm an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Veidt is very busy at the

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Just tell him I'm here. I assure you he'll see me. Dan glares at her. She glares right back. A game of chick She reluctantly gets up, goes inside the office. Once she's gone, Dan's glare disappears, replaced by nervousness. Because he's not sure if Adrian will see him it's been a long time. He glances at the SECURITY GUARDS eyeing him. Finally, the Assistant returns.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Go on in, Mr. Dreiberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan enters the enormous office--there are three TV feeds PROJECTED onto the walls, architectural models of real es developments, poster size ad campaigns for "Nostalgia" perfume--all reflecting the financial empire of Veidt Enterprises owned by-- --ADRIAN VEIDT, late 30s, movie star looks, is at the far of the office, SPRINTING on a treadmill as journalist DOU ROTH holds a tape recorder to him. Adrian sees Dan approaching, smiles wide. He holds up a finger, telling D to hold on a sec. Dan nods, takes a seat on the couch. Pi up a Fortune magazine with Adrian on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: Mr. Veidt, would you acknowledge that you are considered the world's smartest man?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's better to be the world's most modest man. You should ignore my PR people, they tend to be a little too enthusiastic. Though Adrian seems to be sprinting at top speed, he hard seems out of breath as he answers questions.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: If we could move off the subject of business for a moment, I'm curious whether the world's smartest man thinks we're headed for our next World War. Adrian stops the treadmill, towels off as he heads to Dan

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Predicting stock prices isn't the same as predicting world events. I hope there isn't a war, or even a skirmish for that matter. Because Veidt Enterprises has some exciting plans, plans that will, pardon the cliche, truly make this world a better place. My team of engineers and scientists have been working with Dr. Manhattan himself on synthesizing a new, cheap form of energy which will eliminate the worlds reliance on fossil fuels with no toxic emissions. This energy could power cars, aircrafts, stadiums--there are no limitations-- (reaching Dan) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --but I talk too much. Will you mind pausing the interview a moment, Doug? A good friend of mine is here. Doug Roth leaves. Adrian hugs Dan, despite the sweat.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You look good, Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Dan--it's been far too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Adrian sit, talking over coffee. Dan examines an ACTION-FIGURE of Adrian as OZYMANDIAS (his superhero alia

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach. He paid me a visit too.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He did? Must've been tough to get past your security, even for him. I thought your assistant was going to take me out.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara can be tough. Is that why you came to see me? You're worried about this mask killer theory Rorschach's conjured up?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're the world's smartest man, Adrian. You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach's a sociopath suffering through nostalgia. I revealed my identity to the public as soon as the Keene Act was passed. If an old enemy wanted me dead it would have been done already. Adrian notices the news on one of his TV projectors. Something about Pakistan putting troops along the Indian border. Adrian turns up the volume, looking grim.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, there are other things in the world I'm far more concerned about. ON THE WALL: The TV projector shows an image of TWO PAKIS SOLDIERS on patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now actually with the two Soldiers on patrol. One o the Soldiers takes out a pair of binoculars, looking into mountains. (They speak in Baluchi)

dialogues.speaker: PAKISTANI SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We should attack the Indian bastards. I don't understand-- CUT TO: POV--a SNIPER SCOPE, locked in on the Pakistani soldier.

dialogues.speaker: INDIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: --why I can't just pull this trigger. We see two Indian Soldiers, hidden in the mountains, one his sniper rifle aimed. (They speak in Hindi)

dialogues.speaker: INDIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Because then a battle begins. Then a war. And then the Americans will send--

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin) --their blue abomination to intervene. And we don't want that. At the same time, we can't assume to know what's on the minds of our enemies. We're in Chinese waters, off the coast of Taiwan. The CHI CAPTAIN and his First Mate look out at the water. TAIWANE GUNBOATS can be seen in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in the control room as an ISRAELI OFFICER and his m younger AIDE watch SATELLITE IMAGES on the giant screen. Images of potential targets. (They speak in Hebrew)

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: Is Dr. Manhattan even real?

dialogues.speaker: ISRAELI OFFICER
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask the Vietnamese. Or the Iraqis? Dr. Manhattan is real. Thank god for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN posted on a RAZOR-WIRE FENCE reads: ROCKEFELLER MILITARY RESEARCH CENTER. An M16-toting GUARD stands at t gate. We move into Rorschach's POV as he approaches the gate. T guard has no reaction to Rorschach-- --because Rorschach is in disguise, wearing the Army Officer's uniform he stole. Rorschach presents his ID. Th Guard waves him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach ditches the uniform in the trash and puts his m on. He quietly enters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a huge room, which contains technologically advanced MILITARY DEVICES. Distorted in sections of GLASS, we see REFLECTION of a HUGE MAN, GLOWING BRIGHT BLUE--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Good evening, Rorschach. --and we see DR. MANHATTAN (formerly Jon Osterman) for th very first time. He is SIXTY FEET TALL, BLUE LIGHT ripple from his skin, emanating pure power--he is God on earth. works on a reactor--telekinetically moving parts in the a not even looking at Rorschach. It's as if Dr. Manhattan already knew he was coming.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Dr. Manhattan. Dr. Manhattan continues about his business when his girlfriend, LAURIE JUPITER, 30, very much in her prime, enters from the other end.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Jon, did you say some--Rorschach: What are you doing here? You're a wanted man.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Nice to see you too, Silk Spectre.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Don't call me that. My mother made me take that name. I always hated it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Sorry, Miss Jupiter. I thought I should tell you the bad news--the Comedian has been murdered.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, since he and I are the only two extranormal operatives currently employed by the government, I was informed. The CIA suspects one of the radical Islamic groups. Dr. Manhattan shrinks from sixty to six feet in size. He speaks in a cold, even, matter of fact manner.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: I have my own theories. But neither of you seem too concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: A live human body and a dead human body have the same number of particles. Structurally there's no difference.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Well, I might not be able to count molecules, but either way, Blake was a bastard. You know he tried to rape my mother?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Sounds like you may have had a score to settle. You or your mother.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: What? Are you accusing--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach, please don't upset Laurie. I

dialogues.speaker: DON'T--
dialogues.text: He pauses as if he hears something.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a moment. Suddenly he disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of suspicious looking MIDDLE EASTERN MEN watch as CONTAINER is being loaded onto a TRUCK-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --when suddenly Dr. Manhattan materializes in a blue flas floating in mid-air. The Middle Eastern Men shield their from the light, then realize in awe and fear

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE EASTERN MAN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) It's him He's, he's real. Allah help us, he's real! The men run for it but it's useless--Dr. Manhattan shoots BEAMS OF ENERGY at them, freezing all the men in mid moti --when PORT SECURITY pulls up. They get out of their jeep in awe of Dr. Manhattan, still floating in mid-air.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: These men were transporting a shipment of enriched uranium-- With a gesture, the container floats off the truck and separates into pieces . . revealing the URANIUM inside. Suddenly the uranium changes--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've safely transformed the uranium into sand. I trust you can take things from here. And just like that he disappears--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and is back in the lab without missing a beat.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: --I'm not here to judge the moral discrepancies of a man who died in service of his country.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You call rape a moral discrepancy?!

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach--you're upsetting Laurie. I think you ought to go.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: I came here to warn you both, just like I warned Adrian and Dan. I believe someone may be targeting masked heroes--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I said you ought to go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: It took a lot of effort to get in here. I'm not leaving before I've-- With a look, Dr. Manhattan makes Rorschach disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach materializes down the road from the base.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: --had my say Rorschach realizes what just happened. Checks himself, hi surroundings. Reorients himself. With nothing else he can he heads down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Manhattan resumes his work. He looks distracted.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: He's gone. Are you okay now?

dialogues.speaker: YEAH
dialogues.text: (studies Dr. Manhattan) Are you okay, Jon? Dr. Manhattan pauses for a moment, thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I'm having trouble with my vision. I can't see clearly what lies ahead. There's some static interference.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Interference? Caused by what?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I'm uncertain. A power surge of great magnitude? Perhaps a nuclear detonation.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: More war talk. I can't deal with this. I don't want to think about the future right now.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as the "future." I've explained to you on many occasions-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: --that time is simultaneous. There's no past to travel back to, no future to travel forward to, everything happens all at once, our actions affect the course of time instantly, yes I know. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's just a little unnerving to be with someone who can see the future, or whatever you call it.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I understand your frustration, Laurie. The human mind for some reason is only capable of viewing time frame by frame. Perhaps you'd find it more comforting if you could perceive time as I do Dr. Manhattan touches her head--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie's childhood home. We're in Laurie's POV, as a litt girl. There's arguing downstairs. Laurie goes down to investigate. She comes upon the kitchen door, ajar. She can see her PARENTS inside, arguing--

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jon, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the present, Laurie pulls away from Dr. Manhattan touch. That memory seems to be painful for her.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to upset you.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I know. I think I've been cooped up on this base for too long. Rorschach mentioned Dan Dreiberg--we haven't seen him in years. Maybe we can give him a call, see if he's available for dinner tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: You go ahead, Laurie. I want to further investigate this interference with my vision. I find it troubling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie, dressed up and looking gorgeous, heads out when s stopped by a SECRET SERVICE AGENT FORBES.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: Going somewhere, Miss Jupiter?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: I'll have a car brought around in a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: No, thank you. I called a cab already-- it's waiting for me outside. She tries to walk past but Agent Forbes steps in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: You look quite nice. Who are you meeting?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: An old friend of mine. And of Dr. Manhattan's. Now step out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: Please keep in mind, Ms. Jupiter, that your boyfriend is this country's most valuable asset. You need to keep him happy. And on our side. Laurie glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. She brushes past him as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move down the beautifully lit New York city skyline, passing the Brooklyn Bridge . the Statue of Liberty and the in Towers of the World Trade Center? We hear the LAUGHTER--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --of Dan and Laurie as they finish up their meal at this trendy restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You remember that crazy guy, what did he call himself . Captain Carnage! Pretended to be a supervillian just so he could get beat up all the time?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, he tried that with me once. I just walked away but he starts following me down the street in broad daylight yelling, "punish me! punish me!"

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Uh, well, he pulled that on Rorschach and Rorschach dropped him down an elevator shaft. They look at each other, serious, then explode in laughte

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Sorry, sorry, that's not funny. I can't remember the last time I laughed like this. It feels good. Dan looks at her as she finishes her coffee. We can see h smitten with her and that he probably has been for years. Laurie seems oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It's great seeing you again, Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, this was fun. The WAITER arrives with the check; Laurie grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You sure I can't get that?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Let me put my expense account to use. You can thank Uncle Sam. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Laurie nods out the window. Dan turns and sees a GOVERNME SEDAN parked outside.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They've been watching the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Just making sure I'm not doing anything that might upset the country's most powerful weapon.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How is Jon, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I really don't know. It's been harder and harder to tell over the years. It's like his emotions are slowly eroding. To be honest, I can't tell if he even cares about me anymore. They're quiet a moment. Laurie glances at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Laurie step outside.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Y1 know, when I think back, why did we do it? Why did we dress up like that? I think the Keene Act was the best thing to ever happen to us.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're probably right.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I mean, you remember my costume? All that tight spandex? That was awful.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. Awful.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: And to think my own mother pushed me into that spandex. Pushed me into the whole costume thing in the first place. Wanted her little girl to be just like mommy and fight bad guys. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess my ride is here. She gives Dan a hug.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll do this again.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'd really like that. Laurie crosses the street and gets into the sedan. As Dan watches the car drive off, TWO KIDS nearly bump into him, running around playing. The Kids make flying noises.

dialogues.speaker: KID 1
dialogues.text: I'm Dr. Manhattan, saving the Twin Towers!

dialogues.speaker: KID 2
dialogues.text: No, I wanna be Dr. Manhattan!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: You can take turns, okay? Dan watches the Kids for a moment, then walks away. The T Towers looming behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days later. A few mourners gather in the rain for Edward Blake aka The Comedian's funeral. Mostly government types Dan, Adrian and Dr. Manhattan line the edge of an open gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie MATERIALIZES in the hallway of her mother's condo California. She immediately runs to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright California sunshine gleams over this upscale condo facility. Laurie's mother, SALLY, 60s but looks in her 40 reclines by the POOL. She hears someone VOMITING in her condo.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Laurie? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally steps through the sliding glass doors as we hear th toilet FLUSHING. Laurie wobbles out of the bathroom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I'd figure you'd be used to traveling that way by now.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not. I hate it when Jon teleports me.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Margarita?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: No. Sally pours herself a margarita from a pitcher on the counter. We see photos, remnants of Sally from her crimefighting days around the condo. Under the pitcher of margaritas is a days old LA Times with the headline: "Dr. Manhattan Intercepts Terrorists At Port."

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: It's Eddie Blake's funeral today, isn't it? Laurie nods. (From here on, intercut between Blake's fune and Sally's condo) FUNERAL: Blake's coffin is removed from the hearse.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Finally got his punchline, I guess. Poor Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Poor Eddie? How can you say that? After what he--

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Laurie, you're still young. You don't understand how things change as time goes by. FUNERAL: Blake's coffin is carried past Adrian, Dan and D Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Another lesson on time passing. Y'know, you and Jon should get together and write a book on the subject. Sally reaches into a drawer and pulls out the old photo o the Watchmen, the same one with Blake and Hollis Mason in (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: That leaves just two of the old team left. Me and Hollis Mason. She stops at Blake in the photo, regarding him.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Eddie was the Comedian. He always thought he'd get the last laugh. As the PRIEST speaks, we move down the row of mourners, stopping at Dr. Manhattan looking thoughtfully into Blake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATCH CUT TO: Dr. Manhattan. In the night sky, a BURST of FIREWORKS. Outside, a CROWD of Vietnamese people CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Fireworks. A young Blake sits in a derelict Saigon bar, mean drunk. face is devoid of his trademark scar.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'd think this country'd had enough goddamn fireworks. If we'd've lost this war, I think it might have driven us crazy, y'know? As a country. But we didn't. Thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: You sound bitter.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Me? I think it's hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: VIETNAMESE GIRL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Eddie? They both turn. A pretty VIETNAMESE GIRL stands in the do She's pregnant, just starting to show.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Fantastic. Just what I need.

dialogues.speaker: VIETNAMESE GIRL
dialogues.text: The war is over now. We must talk. (touching her abdomen) About this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Blake SLAMS his glass down. He glares at her, drunk and dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: There's nothing to talk about cuz I'm leaving. I'm gonna forget you and your horrible, sweaty little country. He turns away. Her eyes blaze with betrayal and hatred.

dialogues.speaker: VIETNAMESE GIRL
dialogues.text: No. You will remember. You will remember me and my country forever. She SMASHES a bottle. Blake turns just as the broken SHAR SLASH HIS FACE, slicing him his jagged scar

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: You bitch! My face! He PUSHES HER into the bar and DRAWS HIS PISTOL--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Blake . don't. BLAM! Blake shoots her; the Girl SLAMS against the far wa She drops, dead.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blake. She was pregnant. You gunned her down. Blake turns on him, spitting fury.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: That's right! And you know what? You watched me! You could've changed the gun into steam or the bullets into mercury or the bottle into snowflakes, but you didn't, did you? You're drifting outta touch, Doc--I've seen it. Don't tell me the war got to you. Blake walks off shouting "Medic!" Dr. Manhattan turns to girl's body and regards it, curious. MATCH CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Manhattan looking down at Blake's grave. We move down

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is all bullshit. Dan, fit and trim in full Nite Owl regalia, attends the meeting of the "new" Watchmen. Rorschach is there, as is teenage Laurie, dressed in her tight spandex costume. Dr. Manhattan, his age unchanged, stands with his girlfriend JANEY SLATER, though he casts occasional glances at young Laurie . who definitely glances back. Dan also pays Laurie attention, but she is oblivious. A younger Adrian, dressed as Oxymandias, leads the meetin

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: What are you saying, Comedian? Blake, now in his forties, smokes a CIGAR, feet on the ta a FLASK in hand. The PAPER in his hand reads: "Arab Leade Call Dr. Manhattan: 'America's Weapon of Satan."'

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: What I'm saying is this whole bringing back the Watchmen thing is bullshit. It didn't work twenty years ago, and it ain't gonna work just because you want to keep on playing Cowboys and Indians.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Maybe we should agree on no drinking at meetings. Look, Rorschach and I have made real headway on the gang problem by pooling our efforts. Rorschach's voice is quiet, not yet its tortured rasp.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: That's true. But something like this seems too big. Too bureaucratic.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Bureaucracies can be effective with the right leadership--

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: And that would be you, right Veidt? I mean you're the "smartest guy in the world," right?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: It doesn't take a genius to see that the world has problems. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: But it takes a roomful of morons to think they're small enough for you guys to handle. You people are a joke. You hear Moloch's back in town and get your panties in a bunch. You think that matters?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Of course it does. Justice matters.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Justice. Hilarious. There's no such thing as justice. He stands, moving to Adrian's DISPLAY which outlines the Watchmen's agenda: GANGS, RACKETEERING, DRUGS. Blake flic his ZIPPO and the display GOES UP IN FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: My display .

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Justice doesn't matter, alright? Because twenty years from now we're all gonna be dust. Mankind's been trying to kill each other off since the beginning of time and now we finally got the power to finish the job. Ain't nothin' gonna matter when the nukes start flying, and I promise you they will. Then Ozymandias here is gonna be the smartest man on the cinder. He sneers and walks out. Silence. Uncomfortable in the wa of truth, the others pack up to go, muttering apologies t Adrian, but Adrian ignores them, staring at the flames flickering across his face. He seems more thoughtful than upset. MATCH CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian, moving down to Dan as we FADE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWSPAPER BOX. The headlines: "Cops Say: 'Let Them Do I "Senator Keene Proposes Emergency Bill Banning Vigilantis PAN UP TO REVEAL: The streets JAMMED with ANGRY PROTESTOR waving signs decrying vigilantes. ANGLE ON: AN OVAL AIRSHIP--the OWL SHIP--its forward wind sculpted like the eyes of a great owl. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan, in costume, pilots the ship. The Comedian stands out the ship, in one of the "owl eyes," wielding a MACHINE GU

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (over loudspeakers)

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Crawl back in yer holes before you get hurt! I got rubber bullets!

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN CROWD
dialogues.text: We want regular cops! No more vigilantes!

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN CROWD
dialogues.text: My son is a cop, asshole! The Comedian gets HIT IN THE HEAD by a flying SODA CAN.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Okay, that's how you wanna do it?! Smiling grimly, he FIRES TEAR GAS CANNISTERS INTO THE CRO

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh God. (over speakers)

dialogues.speaker: CHOICE. PLEASE CLEAR THE STREETS
dialogues.text: The Comedian DIVES into the crowd, knocking random people aside with his rifle butt, then starts firing rubber bull into the crowd. The protestors scatter and retreat. Dan l the Owl Ship, exits wearing a GAS MASK, hands one to Blak

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Comedian, this is a nightmare! The whole city is erupting!

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Hah! You seen this? The smoke clears enough for Dan to see a message SPRAY- PAINTED on a brick wall: "WHO WATCHES THE WATCHMEN?"

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How long can we keep this up?

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: My government contacts tell me they're pushing some new bill through Congress. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Until then, we're society's only protection.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Protection from what? Blake laughs, exultant in the blowing smoke, the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? From themselves. CLOSE ON: the happy face pin on Blake's costume. MATCH CU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Dan fingering Blake's happy face pin.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Lord have mercy upon us. Amen. Dan DROPS the pin into Blake's grave. The mourners linger moment as dirt is shoveled onto Blake's casket, then star filing out. We follow one particular mourner all the way the back--a LONE MAN, as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lone Man leaves quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lone Man removes his hat and coat. He is old, withere He is EDGAR JACOBI. In his younger days, he was a supervillain known as MOLOCH--we recognize him from the n clipping in Blake's closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moloch goes to the REFRIGERATOR, opens it. Then stops, staring. There is a scrawled NOTE inside. Moloch picks it in spiky handwriting it reads: "LOOK BEHIND YOU." Over Moloch's shoulder Rorschach's hat-brim TILTS UP. As Moloch turns, Rorschach lunges, PINS Moloch's ARM behind back and SLAMS him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Edgar William Jacobi. Also known as Edgar William Vaughn. Also known as William Edgar Bright. Also known as Moloch.

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I'm a retired business maaAAAHHH! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rorschach TWISTS the man's arm back viciously.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Lie again, I'll break your arm.

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: Oh God, please. I did my time. I'm not Moloch anymore. What do you want from me? Rorschach lets him go. Moloch's hollow eyes follow him.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: You attended a funeral today. Why?

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: The funeral? I don't know why I went. I just felt I should. I'd been thinking about the Comedian-- Rorschach SLAMS Moloch against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: How did you know Blake was the Comedian?

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: He broke in here! A week ago! He, he had his mask off. He was drunk--

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: You were enemies for forty years. Why would he visit you?

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: I don't know! I woke up in my bedroom and there he was! He was upset! Crying!

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: The Comedian? Crying?

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: He, he was babbling, not making sense. I was pissing in my pants--I thought he was going to kill me!

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: What did he say?!

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: He said he was wrong. About it all being a joke, that it wasn't funny anymore. He said he was scared-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Scared of what?!

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: Something he saw, I think. He said something about wishing he never broke into that building. But that he had to keep his mouth shut. Then, then he left! Rorschach studies Moloch a moment, then releases him.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Hm. Funny story. Sounds unbelievable. Probably true. Rorschach glances around the kitchen. He opens some drawe looking inside. He picks up a stack of MAIL, flips throug it. One of the envelopes contains a PENSION CHECK from "Pyramid Industries."

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: So that's it? I'm clean?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Clean? I searched your house. Found illegal drugs.

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: Illegal--I don't use drugs. Rorschach pulls a PILL BOTTLE from his coat.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Laetril. Phony medication made from apricot pits. Illegal.

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: oh c-come on. Look, please don't confiscate that. I'm trying anything . I have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: What kind of cancer?

dialogues.speaker: MOLOCH
dialogues.text: The kind you don't get better from.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Fine. You're off the hook, for now. If you remember anything else, leave me a note in the trash can opposite the Gunga Diner at Fortieth and Seventh. Keep out of trouble, Moloch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Rorschach blasting through the night air as the city streams by. This close, he appears to be flying.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rorschach's Journal, October 17th. Thought about Moloch's story on my way to the cemetery. Could all be lies. A scheme for revenge planned during his years behind bars. CUT WIDE: To reveal he is actually PERCHED ATOP AN ELEVAT SUBWAY CAR. Just one way he gets around.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But if it's true, then what? What could have possibly scared the Comedian? What building was he talking about? What was it that he saw? So many questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach stands alone over Blake's fresh grave. Paying h proper respects.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Edward Blake--the Comedian. Born 1944, buried in the rain. Murdered. FLASH TO: Blake, the night of his murder, turning as his is kicked in.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Violent lives ending violently. FLASH TO: Adrian's display burning.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Blake understood. Humans are violent in nature. No matter how much you try to dress it up, to disguise it. FLASHES OF: The group photo of the old Watchmen. Then the photo of the new Watchmen.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Blake saw the true face of human kind and chose to become a parody of it, treated it like a joke. FLASHES OF: Blake being beaten in his apartment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I heard a joke once. Man goes to a doctor, says he's depressed. Life seems harsh and cruel. Blake is KICKED in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Says he feels all alone in a threatening world. Blake stands alone in the blowing tear gas smoke.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Doctor says, "the treatment is simple. The great clown Pagliacci is in town tonight. Go and see him. That should pick you up." Blake is lifted up by the Intruder's hands.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The man bursts into tears. A bloodied Blake laughs at the Intruder.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: "But doctor," he says. ULTRA-SLOW, Blake crashes through his apartment window.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "I am Pagliacci." Blake FLIES TOWARD FRAME on his silent trip to the ground

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Good joke. Everybody laugh. Blake FALLS INTO FRAME--GO BLACK .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Laurie, eyes closed with pleasure, as Dr. Manhattan's GLOWING BLUE HANDS caress her face.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Mmm. What time do you have to be at your TV interview?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we have plenty of time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eyes still closed, she does not see a THIRD BLUE HAND tra line down her cheek. She kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Hey, your finger, it's like licking a battery. It's all-- She opens her eyes. They widen in shock and horror as she sees TWO DR. MANHATTANS in bed with her.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God! That's horrible! Stop it! Laurie jumps up. The two Dr. Manhattans stand, confused.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN 1 DR. MANHATTAN 2
dialogues.text: Please don't be upset. I thought you'd enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I--You startled me, that's all

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN 1
dialogues.text: I don't know what stimulates you anymore. Laurie backs into the hall, trying to get a grip.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Forget about it. I overreacted. It was just strange to see-- Laurie can now see into the KITCHEN, where yet a THIRD DR MANHATTAN is working on an experiment. Her eyes blaze.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How long have you been working in here?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN 1
dialogues.text: Laurie, try to understand--

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Understand!? You're working in here at the same time we're in bed!?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN 3
dialogues.text: My work with Adrian is at an important stage. It seemed unnecessary to--

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Shut up! Just SHUT YOUR MOUTH! Laurie WHIPS a full BEAKER at 3's chest. It PASSES THROUG HIM and SMASHES IN THE KITCHEN SINK. Laurie storms out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN 3
dialogues.text: Laurie, please--If you think there's a problem with my attitude, I'm prepared to discuss it-- As he speaks, the smashed BEAKER and its contents RISE IN THE AIR, REASSEMBLING perfectly in the palm of 3's hand. IN THE HALL: Laurie nearly bumps into Dr. Manhattan 2.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN 2
dialogues.text: --but logically, not clouded with human emotion.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Human emotion? You were human once. That's the problem, Jon. You've forgotten that.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN 2
dialogues.text: Laurie, where are you-- The door slams. Laurie's left. For good. Dr. Manhattan 2 stands there. He walks back to the BEDROO where 1 is. Dr. Manhattan 1 holds an OLD PHOTO. In the ph is a COUPLE, smiling into the camera. We recognize the wo as Janey Slater, Dr. Manhattan's ex-girlfriend, who we sa Adrian's flashback at Blake's funeral. We recognize the m in the photo as . Dr. Manhattan. When he was human. Dr. Manhattan stares at the photo. Perhaps feeling the ti of human emotion again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan heats up some leftover Chinese food in the microwave the TV plays in the B/G:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANALYST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --no one's fired their weapons yet, but no one's lowered them either. Maybe these other countries aren't so afraid of Dr. Manhattan, maybe they're calling the President's bluff. I'm very curious to see what Dr. Manhattan himself has to say in his live interview which should be in about an hour or so BOOM, BOOM! Dan looks up. Someone's banging on the door. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan approaches the door, cautious, mask killer on his min

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Laurie? It takes a few moments for him to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, I had a new lock installed, it's a little sticky--

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I left Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan pours a teary eyed Laurie a glass of RED WINE.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Did, uh, the Secret Service follow you here?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I lost them in the subways. I think.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Living with him . Dan, you don't know what it's been like. INTERCUT TO: Dr. Manhattan, holding Laurie's BRA. Staring

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The way he looks at things, like he can't remember what they are, like he doesn't really care. This world, the real world to him it's like walking through mist, and all the people are just shadows. Shadows in the fog. Dr. Manhattan lowers his head. A SHADOW FALLS OVER HIM. H looks up to see a THREE PIECE SUIT floating before him-- waiting for its wearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Laurie walk the streets, getting some air.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I hope I didn't ruin your night.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Not at all. I was just going to see Hollis for our weekly beer session. You're more than welcome to join. In fact, I insist They pass the news stand from the opening scene. The Home Man is arguing with the News Vendor:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS VENDOR
dialogues.text: --I told you, this month's issue still hasn't arrived yet! Why do you care about that right wing rag so much? Cuz those bastards don't give a damn about you, pal! They--hold up, here it comes. They turn as SEYMOUR, a fat slob of a man, arrives with a BUNDLE of the latest issue of "The New Frontiersman." CUT TO: Dr. Manhattan stepping THROUGH and INTO the empty floating suit. His TIE knots itself. Dr. Manhattan looks around the empty room . sad? Again, he looks at the photo of him and Janey Slater . . then DISAPPEARS IN A BURST OF PARTICLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Laurie turn down a darker, less populated street.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Laurie, will you please stop apologizing? I'm here for you anytime. SHADOWS trail behind them, ominous. Someone's following.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I know. I just find it rude when people show up at your door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main waiting area. People go about their jobs. The RECEPTIONIST hears a strange, electric CRACKLING (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: --completely out of the blue. Suddenly, Dr. Manhattan appears in a burst of energy. The receptionist SHRIEKS. The PRODUCER looks out his office.

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCER
dialogues.text: Terrific. Dr. Manhattan arrives and no one thinks to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: He, he just--

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCER
dialogues.text: All geez. We don't have time for make-up. That blue is too light for television. The light from Dr. Manhattan's SKIN DARKENS to a DEEPER B

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Is this dark enough?

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCER
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Laurie turn down an alley. We now see who's follo them--a group of YOUNG THUGS.

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: that's dark enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A White House PRESS AGENT escorts Dr. Manhattan to the se

dialogues.speaker: PRESS AGENT
dialogues.text: Just another reminder that if the second Geneva Convention comes up, our official position is that talks will not resume until the Chinese agree to exclude you from the agenda. The President approved this interview because he wanted to strengthen morale at home and to gently remind the rest of the world who holds the cards. Please keep that in mind. Dr. Manhattan stands off stage, waiting. The LIGHTS come and we're live with the glossy NEWS HOST. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NEWS HOST
dialogues.text: He's been called many things; Hero, weapon, linchpin of our security-- CUT TO: Dan and Laurie turning as the Young Thugs BLOCK T ALLEYWAY. One of the Thugs pulls a KNIFE. Laurie and Dan exchange a look. Dan removes his glasses. CUT BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS HOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His given name is Jonathan Osterman--Dr. Jonathan Osterman--a renowned nuclear physicist who through a terrible accident became the man the world knows today as Dr. Manhattan. The audience APPLAUDS loudly as Dr. Manhattan takes his s

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS HOST
dialogues.text: Thank you, Dr. Manhattan, and not simply for appearing on this program. I believe I speak for all of America when I thank you for thwarting the terrorist plot at the port of Long Beach over a week ago-- Furious applause from the audience, which Dr. Manhattan regards curiously.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: It was my duty. CUT TO: Dan and Laurie surrounded by the Thugs . when suddenly they DIVE INTO the group, fighting like the hero they once were. Dan grapples with one of the Thugs and knocks his knife a --when another Thug nails him from behind with a BAT. Dan drops to the ground . BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: NEWS HOST
dialogues.text: Before we start, I want to explain to our viewers the unconventional format for this interview. Our live audience is made up entirely of news media and Dr. Manhattan will be taking questions from the floor. This commercial free broadcast is presented to you by Veidt Enterprises. We see Adrian standing near the audience with the Press Agent, smiling for the camera. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CUT TO: Laurie, driving a FIST into a Thug's NOSE, when another Thug GRABS HER HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS HOST, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We will now take our first question-- The Thug draws a PISTOL on her. Dan, still on the ground, sees the gun and his eyes narrow, harden. He pushes himse up off the ground. CUT BACK TO: The TV Studio AUDIENCE: where Doug Roth, the journalist who interviewed Adrian earlier, stands.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: Dr. Manhattan, Doug Roth, Nova Times. Do you remember a man named Wally Weaver?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, he was a good friend of mine. When we were both physicists.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: He died of cancer.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I remember. I attended his funeral.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: How about Edgar Jacobi, also known as the supervillian Moloch? You had a lot of battles with him, didn't you? Did you know that he has cancer as-well? The News Host looks confused. Adrian turns to the Press Agent, growing concerned with where this is leading. CUT TO: Dan, snapping the GUNMAN'S wrist back and up-- Barrel aimed at the Thug's CHIN. In the last fraction of second, Dan SHIFTS the gun two inches left as it FIRES, deafening the Thug, but leaving him alive. BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I was not aware--

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: And what about Jose Flores? He was the longtime janitor at the Watchmen Headquarters where you worked for many years. Cancer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: By your line of questioning, you're suggesting that I was the cause of cancer in these individuals.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: You tell me, doc. Adrian turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Doug, that `s enough.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: It is irrelevant whether I was the cause or not.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: Irrelevant?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: A live human body and a dead human body have the same number of particles. Structurally there's no difference. An appalled then angry buzz comes over the audience.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: What about Janey Slater? Do you think it makes a difference to her?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Janey Slater? Wh--

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: Your ex-girlfriend, she was a physicist too. You were with her for ten years. Or does she have to remind you herself? Suddenly Janey Slater emerges from a door at the top of t stands. She is old now, frail, barely recognizable from t images we've see of her.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She has cancer as well. Doctors have given her six months. What do you have to say, Ms. Slater? He sticks the microphone in her face.

dialogues.speaker: JANEY SLATER
dialogues.text: D-damn you, Jon. God damn you (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She leaves as fast as she came, bursting into tears. Dr. Manhattan stands, visibly shaken--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: No, Janey, wait! In the audience, Adrian turns to the Press Agent, frantic

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: We need to stop this now. Adrian and the Press Agent hurry on stage, SECURITY following.

dialogues.speaker: PRESS AGENT
dialogues.text: That's it! Interview's over! BACK TO: The alley, littered with the unconscious BODIES the Thugs. Laurie and Dan lean back on the wall, gasping air, horribly out of shape, but victorious. CUT TO: The TV studio, as Adrian and Security surround Dr Manhattan, trying to escort him out. The audience spills of the stands, RUSHING Dr. Manhattan with questions and, FLASHING cameras--it's madness. Adrian shoves a camera ou Dr. Manhattan's face.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: As the sponsor of this program I demand all cameras off! His plea is futile, of course. A REPORTER breaks through, gets in Dr. Manhattan's face.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 1
dialogues.text: Did you give Ms. Slater cancer by sleeping with her?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: No. Please let me through

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 2
dialogues.text: Do you even care about human life?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Please. If everyone would just go away and leave me alone. Adrian hears the note of warning in his voice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Everyone back off! Don't you understand? He's the only thing preventing the world from chaos!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG ROTH
dialogues.text: How many other people did you do this to? Dr. Manhattan finally SNAPS--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I said LEAVE ME ALONE! Every last person BURSTS INTO PARTICLES and DISAPPEARS. D Manhattan is suddenly alone. He looks stunned almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV audience materializes out on the roof

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Laurie exit the quiet alley, trying to play it of

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I should find a hotel. God. Imagine, us getting mugged.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why don't you come by Hollis' with me? Shake off the adrenaline.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: No thanks, I've had enough hero stuff for one night. (walking away) You take care, Dan. It's a dangerous world out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis opens the door for Dan--

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know, you won't believe it--

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: You missed it--Dr. Manhattan just lost it on live TV. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Wait, what? Dan turns to the TV, which replays the clip of Dr. Manhat being accosted and then teleporting everyone to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was just with Laurie. She doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: She'll know soon enough. The whole world will know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie rides in back, staring out at the street, calming down. The cab stops at a red light; The CABBIE takes outa ZIPPO,lights a cigarette. Laurie stares at the FLAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: like she stares at the flame here, as Adrian's display burns. Laurie glances around as everyone leaves, apologiz to Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside Watchmen HQ, Dan's Owl Ship rises out of view. Rorschach skulks off into the shadows. Dr. Manhattan and Janey Slater get into a Town Car as young Laurie watches around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Laurel? Laurel Jane? Startled, Laurie turns. Blake steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're Sally Jupiter's kid.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You're the Comedian, right? You were pretty cool in there. Blake lights a smoke, looks her over.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: You got your mom's eyes. Even that funny little mole.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Got another smoke? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: She was one of the all-time champion beauties, your mom. She talk about me much?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: No. Not really. As Blake gives her a light, Laurie touches his hand to co the lighter from the wind. She looks up at him, sly.

dialogues.speaker: TAKE YOUR HANDS OFF HER.
dialogues.text: Laurie nearly jumps out of her skin. A younger Sally marc toward them from a LIMO, waiting at the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Hey Doll. Long time no see.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Not long enough in my book, Eddie. She eyes Laurie with cool death.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put that out. Get in the car. INSIDE THE LIMO: Laurie cracks her window an inch. Her mother's harsh, low tone drifts clearly back.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are there no depths you won't sink to?

dialogues.speaker: BLAKE
dialogues.text: Christ, we were just talking! Can't a guy talk to his, y'know, friend's daughter? What the hell do you think I am?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I know what you are, Eddie. I've always known. Don't ever forget that. Driving off, Laurie watches Blake through the window--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --like she watches through the window in the present. The light turns green-- --when a BLACK SUV pulls in front of the cab, BLOCKING it path. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Cabbie honks his horn as a team of SECRET SERVICE AGE get out of the SUV. Agent Forbes knocks on Laurie's windo

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: Ms. Jupiter, you need to come with us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Forbes escorts her into the room.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I don't understand, what do you mean, Jon's gone?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: I mean he snapped and disappeared during the interview. Now our trackers can't detect him anywhere on the planet. If we want to find him you're our only hope. A TECHNICIAN wires Laurie up; GRAPHS record Laurie's neur responses, MONITORS show satellite images.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN 1
dialogues.text: Miss Jupiter, we need you to visualize Dr. Manhattan. Do you need a prompt?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN 2
dialogues.text: Neurotransmissions tracking.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN 3
dialogues.text: Transmitting on all frequencies.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN 1
dialogues.text: We're ready Miss Jupiter. We need you to try and talk to him. Laurie, wired like a porcupine, seems embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Jon? Jon, can you hear me? The GRAPH-NEEDLES jump and tick, searching . when a high, clear TONE rings through the room. Needles fly. Technicians dash to lock it down. Agent Forb hurries to the graph, looking over their shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: Have you got him? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN 1
dialogues.text: We've located his signal, yes.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: Well? Where the hell is he? The Technician looks up, not happy about the answer.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN 1
dialogues.text: He's on Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUGE DISHES scan the skies. We hear the high, clear tone, above all the RADIO CHATTER, NEWS REPORTS and MILITARY FREQUENCIES, the endless, echoing chaff of the world...

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER 1, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: --massive mobilization of troops in
