dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER 2, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: --unconfirmed reports of a gunfire exchange in Tehran--

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER 3, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: --prompting the President to call an emergency meeting with his National Security Advisors--

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jon. Can you hear me, Jon? But these VOICES get progressively QUIETER, as we-- ZOOM BACK: Up, out of the atmosphere, at a blinding rate-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --landing on A VAST MARTIAN PLAIN, and the tiny BLUE FIGU walking across it, RED DUST BILLOWING behind him. The pea and quiet after the cacophony of Earth is soothing. Dr. Manhattan stops, looking over the landscape. He holds photo of him and Janey Slater in his hand, when he was hu He stares at the photo a moment and closes his eyes-- --and we FLASHBACK to the moment that photo was taken. He Janey are at a CARNIVAL. After the flash, Janey turns to

dialogues.speaker: JANEY SLATER
dialogues.text: Aww, Jon, look--you've got cotton candy on the side of your mouth (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON OSTERMAN
dialogues.text: You do too. Here, let me get it for you. He pulls her close. They giggle like the young lovers the are and then kiss, passionate BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan walking on mars' surface. He approaches a LARGE ROCK FORMATION which blocks his path. He PARTS the rock formation telekinetically, like Moses parting the sea-- --and we FLASHBACK, mirroring the parting of the rock formation to the parting of two SLIDING DOORS, in the LAB A NUCLEAR TESTING FACILITY, as Jon steps into the REACTOR CHAMBERГ‚ВЂВ”

dialogues.speaker: JON OSTERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (YELLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch up with you guys--I left my watch inside . Jon backs into the chamber without noticing the DIGITAL C above the doors counting down: 3 2 1--"TIME LOCK INITIATED"--the doors CLOSE . BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan on Mars as he stops to pick up a STRANGE ROCK. It's beautiful--the colors, the crystals-- unlike anything we've ever seen-- --and we FLASHBACK to Jon's lab COLLEAGUES watching in ho as Jon retrieves his WATCH, oblivious. They try to open t door, but it's no use--the time lock can't be overridden. Janey arrives, SCREAMS when she sees Jon inside. Jon turn sees all the terrified faces staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: JON OSTERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Janey? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JANEY SLATER
dialogues.text: The time lock, Jon! As it dawns on Jon, he hears the hum of the REACTOR INITIATING, the big mechanical parts moving. Jon runs to door, BANGS on it.

dialogues.speaker: JON OSTERMAN
dialogues.text: Janey: Oh my god! TEARS stream down Janey's face as she looks at him throug the thick glass, helpless, hopeless. Inside, the chamber starts to GLOW . (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JANEY SLATER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jon, I can't-- Janey can't bear to watch--she runs out of the lab as the reactor initiates

dialogues.speaker: JANEY
dialogues.text: . and with a BLINDING FLASH--Jon and his watch are OBLITERATED to bits . BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan on Mars, as he obliterates the str rock he was holding to bits and we FLASHBACK to the lab CAFETERIA. Janey sits at a table, crying softly, being consoled by her colleagues CUT TO: OUTSIDE THE NUCLEAR FACILITY, by the barbed wire fences, A DISEMBODIED BRAIN, A SET OF EYES, AND A SPINAL COLUMN MATERIALIZES . BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan on Mars, as he RISES into the air. a thought, the RED SAND FUSES into a beautiful, PINK GLAS

dialogues.speaker: STRUCTURE--
dialogues.text: --and we FLASHBACK to the cafeteria KITCHEN as a COOK SHR at A WALKING NETWORK OF HUMAN VEINS-- BACK TO: The pink glass structure on Mars which SPREADS O INTO COMPLEX GLASS PATTERNS, RISING FROM THE PLAIN at Dr. Manhattan's command-- --and we FLASHBACK to the cafeteria HALLWAY as a SKELETON passes two terrified GUARDS BACK TO: Dr. Manhattan, now dwarfed by the RISING, EVOLVI GLASS STRUCTURE, which begins to resemble parts of a WATC --and we FLASHBACK to the cafeteria. Janey's still crying One of her Colleagues reaches for her hand when STATIC SP snap around them. All over the cafeteria, the METAL UTENS begin to SPARK. In the center of the room, GLOWING BLUE PARTICLES begin to collect, SLAMMING INTO EACH OTHER with amazing force and in a BLINDING FLASH, THE PARTICLES FORM DR. MANHATTAN, hovering over the room like a newborn god. Everyone in the cafeteria looks up in awe, in fear and--

dialogues.speaker: JANEY SLATER
dialogues.text: Oh god . Jon is that you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --recognition. BACK TO: Mars, where Dr. Manhattan's GLASS PALACE rises i its full glory. A home fit for a god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT FROM: A SATELLITE IMAGE of MARS. NOISE filters b in, as TECHNICIANS buzz this way and that, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: There must be some way to contact him. Laurie sits in the room, largely forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Agent Forbes.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT FORBES
dialogues.text: (distracted, annoyed) What?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I need to go to the bathroom. Agent Forbes gives her a look, then waves for a SECRET SERVICE AGENT to escort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie heads to the bathroom, trailed by the Secret Servi Agent. As she reaches the bathroom door-- --she suddenly SPINS and ELBOWS the agent in the GROIN. T Agent buckles; Laurie grabs him by his coat, SHOVES his h through the bathroom door and SLAMS THE DOOR on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie drags the groggy Agent into the bathroom. She take his GUN, pulls it on him.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You're getting me out of here.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
dialogues.text: We're only detaining you for national security purposes. Don't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Don't you understand that sitting there with a bunch of high tech radios and monitors isn't going to bring him back? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only one thing can bring ion back and that's Jon. If he wants to find me, he's quite capable of doing so on his own. I've been a prisoner in my live long enough. You are taking me out of here because if you don't, and Jon does come back, I'm going to let him know who was naughty and who was nice. And he won't give you a lump of coal--he'll turn you into one, understand? The Agent eyes her, then reluctantly gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sleeps peacefully in his bed when a SHADOW moves over . dropping a NEWSPAPER on his LAP, waking Dan with a gasp. Rorschach hovers beside the bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Jesus! Rorschach

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Good morning, Daniel. I brought in your paper. Dan reads the headline: "DR. MANHATTAN LEAVES EARTH."

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Comedian murdered. Dr. Manhattan exiled. Two of us gone within a week. Who's next? Veidt? Ms. Jupiter? Me? You? Rorschach turns for the door as Dan reads the story.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way, that new lock broke after one shove.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: My new lock?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Get a stronger one, Daniel. You can't be too security conscious these days.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: These days nobody's safe. We see the same Pakistani Soldiers from before, only now there are dozens more TROOPS with them, mobilizing on the border as are their Indian counterparts-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CUT TO: The Chinese Battleships we saw before, moving tow the coast of Taiwan. They FIRE SHOTS-- CUT TO: The Israel Missile Control room we were in before bustles with frantic action.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: --three synagogues were bombed in Tel Aviv, a bus exploded in Jerusalem--

dialogues.speaker: ISRAELI OFFICER
dialogues.text: Enough! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin the first wave of air strikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE MAP OF THE WORLD is projected onto the war-room screens. The President and his ADVISORS look up at it.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY OF STATE
dialogues.text: The Chinese have already made their move. India and Pakistan have engaged and everyone in the Middle East is going at Israel. Time to start picking sides, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Forget picking sides--first, are we safe?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY OF HOMELAND SECURITY
dialogues.text: We've increased security at all entry points: water ports, airports and border patrol.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: I want the National Guard put on the border. As for the rest of it . let's not jump into the fray just yet.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY OF DEFENSE
dialogues.text: Mr. President, I urge you to--

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Let's just wait, okay?! Maybe he'll come back. (beat, wishful) Maybe he'll come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian steps off the elevator when he's met by his Assist (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Clock's ticking, Mr. Veidt.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I know. I'm meeting the toy people, yes?

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Eleven-thirty. They want to talk to you about some new villains for the "Ozymandias" line.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: All the old villains are dead.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: What's with everybody today? Everyone's on this death trip.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I suppose the threat of war has that effect. ACROSS THE WAY, Dan enters the building, intercepts Adria

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Adrian, I need to talk to you. Adrian looks put off.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Dan, I'm sorry, this is a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: But what about what happened with ion? Adrian excuses himself from his Assistant.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Jon's departure is terrible. Not only for what's happening in the world now, but for what could have happened. The energy project he and I were working on--it's dead now .

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach came to see me again. Maybe there's something to this mask killer thing.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Are you still preoccupied with the ramblings of that lunatic? I really don't have time for this, Dan. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Adrian walks away, continuing on with his Assistant when a MAN in a TRENCHCOAT approaches the pair. He DRAWS GUN on them .

dialogues.speaker: PERSONAL ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Sometimes I can't bear to watch the news. It makes it so hard to be optimistic Is that a gun? Dan sees what's happening--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Adrian! BANG! The man SHOOTS the Assistant in the gut; Adrian immediately springs into action--he moves with unbelievab speed and quickness, grabbing a velvet ROPE-STANCHION-- --DEFLECTING A SECOND BULLET with it-- --and SMASHING IT INTO THE FACE OF THE ASSASSIN, knocking into a FOUNTAIN. SECURITY GUARDS run, guns drawn, toward the fountain wher Adrian GRAPPLES with the dazed man.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Mr. Veidt! Let us handle it!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Wait, he's got a poison capsule! He JAMS his fingers into the Assassin's mouth when Dan arrives.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't bite down, you scum! I want to know who sent you! The Assassin's eyes BULGE

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to know who's behind this! The Assassin CHOKES and dies. Adrian DROPS him, unanswered. He looks over at Dan, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Laurie sit in the back of the cafe, making sure t have privacy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Where's Adrian now?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Talking to the cops. Thank god he's still in great shape. You get so caught up with the whole smartest man in the world thing you forget what a physical specimen he is- -he's as fast as I've ever seen him (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. I can't go stay with my mom- -I'm sure that's the first place they'll look. But I need to get out of the city. It's only a matter of time before they find me.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Listen, why don't you . how about you stay at my place?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Oh, Dan, I couldn't impose--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be an imposition, I have an extra room. We're friends. And with everything that's been happening

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You're buying into Rorschach's "mask killer" theory?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. But it can't hurt to be safe. Besides, I've already had one wanted person visit me, another one won't make a difference. They look at each other. Laurie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Okay. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this guy who tried to kill Adrian--who was he?

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Some local low-life named Roy Chess (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rorschach investigates the apartment of ROY CHESS, Adrian would-be assassin. The place is decent but messy. Rorschach spots a PORNO MAG on the coffee table. On the c nearby, a pair of PANTS. Rorschach picks them up, reaches into the pockets. He pulls out some cash, credit cards-- --and an ID for Pyramid Industries. It says Chess was a security guard . and then Rorschach remembers the pension check he saw at Moloch's house. From Pyramid Industries. Rorschach sees a LAPTOP over on the kitchen table. The computer is on and shows the SERVER for Pyramid Industrie Rorschach navigates the server until he finds the EMPLOYE DIRECTORY. Once in the directory he pauses for a second. Then he typ in a name: "Jane Slater." A photo of Janey Slater pops up--"Status: RETIRED." Rorschach stares at the screen, excited at the connection

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in Rorschach's POV as he walks down the street. Fro the non-reaction of passers by, he obviously doesn't have mask on.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rorschach's Journal, October 19th. Someone tried to kill Adrian Veidt. Proves mask killer theory--the murderer is closing in. Pyramid Industries is the key. Rorschach approaches a TRASH CAN. He rummages through it finds an ENVELOPE. He opens it and finds a NOTE that read "Tonight 11:30, M."

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Checked mail drop, got a message from Moloch. Was just going to pay him a visit. Rorschach turns down an alley, approaches a DUMPSTER. He reaches behind the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: My things are where I left them. My coat. My gloves (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Still in his POV, we watch him put each article on. Then pulls out his MASK.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: . my face. Rorschach pulls his mask on, FILLING THE SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: MOLOCH'S EYES staring fearfully out the rainy window. Rorschach APPEARS in the darkness behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Somebody tried to shoot the world's smartest man today, Moloch. Moloch sits at the kitchen table. CLOSE ON: MOLOCH'S HAND ignored CIGARETTE smolders. In his other hand, a NOTE.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hitman worked for Pyramid Industries. So did Janey Slater and everyone else Dr. Manhattan allegedly gave cancer to. And last time I was here, I saw a pension check sent to you from the same company-- obviously a front set up by whoever it is that killed the Comedian, that pushed Dr. Manhattan over the edge, that wants us masks dead. Is that why you left me a note in my mail drop? You have something to confess? Rorschach turns. A HOLE gapes between Moloch's staring ey A PISTOL lies on the table--Moloch's dead. Rorschach carefully pulls the NOTE from Moloch's hand. It the note Rorschach had left in Moloch's refrigerator, the that reads: "LOOK BEHIND YOU." Behind Rorschach, BLINDING LIGHT GLARES THROUGH THE WINDO

dialogues.speaker: DET. FINE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (over LOUDSPEAKERS)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WE KNOW YOU'RE IN THERE.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: No. No, no, no

dialogues.speaker: THEM OUT UNHARMED.
dialogues.text: Moloch's corpse stares at Rorschach. Rorschach TEARS OPEN cupboards, pulling items off the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Framed. Set up. Walked right into it. Stupid, stupid, stupid.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Heh. Never. Never surrender. Rorschach takes an AEROSOL CAN and a PEPPER SHAKER.

dialogues.speaker: ALRIGHT. I HOPE YOU'RE READY, "HERO."
dialogues.text: Rorschach's mask DISAPPEARS back into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: When you are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! Moloch's door is SMASHED OPEN. Armed SWAT COPS swa in, but no more than three can fit in the narrow entry wa

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP 1
dialogues.text: It's a bum tip, I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP 2-
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes open. SWAT Cop 1 moves down the hall, carelessly ahead of forma --BEHIND HIM, Rorschach APPEARS out of the darkness. He IGNITES the AEROSOL CAN'S STREAM, SPRAYING THE COPS WITH FIRE. They fall back, screaming, shooting. SWAT Cop 1 cat the worst of it--he DROPS AND ROLLS on the floor, trying extinguish the flames on him. Rorschach BOLTS upstairs, IGNITING the staircase behind h Pandemonium. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP 3
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP 2
dialogues.text: Upstairs! He's upstairs! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT COPS top the 2nd floor landing, already lit by fire.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP 3
dialogues.text: Where is he?! (into radio) Send the second team in! Graves is down! And we need a fire unit. All this smoke--

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP 2
dialogues.text: Stay calm, the file says he never goes armed. Rorschach APPEARS, blowing PEPPER INTO COP 2'S EYES.

dialogues.speaker: SWAT COP 3
dialogues.text: Get out of the way! I don't have room to-- SWAT Cop 3 CLEARS his line of fire and finds Rorschach AIMING THE GRAPPLING GUN AT HIS CHEST .

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: The HOOK BLOWS THE BODY-ARMORED COP OVER THE RAILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Det. Gallagher and Fine watch from behind a LINE OF COP C The house is now BLAZING. Smoke and men's screams drift o

dialogues.speaker: DET. FINE
dialogues.text: We've got him. There's no way out. From the second floor, Rorschach SMASHES THROUGH THE WIND snarling like a rabid dog, landing hard on the concrete. ankle TWISTS, dropping him to the ground. Rorschach struggles to get to his feet. When he looks up finds TWENTY COPS IN A SEMI-CIRCLE before him. A loaded, pregnant pause. The COPS RUSH FORWARD. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Rorschach holds up a gloved hand. And they all stop, unsure what this lunatic will do next.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Ten years. I've waited for this. He beckons them forward. The cops PILE INTO HIM. Rorschac brutally disables six cops before he is overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No pain. Must get up. Find who framed me-- A Cop KICKS HIM in the throat. Rorschach drops again.

dialogues.speaker: FINE
dialogues.text: Get that mask off him!

dialogues.speaker: COP 1
dialogues.text: I got it. Christ, he stinks!

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: No no no NO NO NO! The Cop peels back the shifting mask to reveal the Homele Man from the news stand. He screams at them wildly.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My face! Give it back to me! Rorschach is finally beaten, surrounded by cops, as Moloc house blazes in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan is at the front door, fixing the lock Rorschach buste twice, when Laurie comes down the stairs, yawning.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Noon. Thought I'd let you sleep in. Laurie smiles at him. Is Dan crazy or does he sense a spa She touches his shoulder as she turns into the living roo then turns on the TV: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: Today, police searched the apartment of Walter Kovacs, better known as the masked vigilante Rorschach. Kovacs was captured last night and charged with the murder of Edgar Jacobi, formerly known as the supervillain Moloch. Moloch was found shot in the head at point blank range. Both Dan and Laurie stop what they're doing, eyes fixed o the TV: They see Rorschach, unmasked, IN SHACKLES.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Inside the decrepit apartment, police discovered stacks of right-wing literature, including several years of back issues of the ultra-conservative publication, "The New Frontiersman." We asked "New Frontiersman" editor, Hector Godfrey, for comment. CUT TO: A clip of the EDITOR being interviewed. We see Seymour, who we met at the news stand, in the background.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: Rorschach is an American patriot and we are proud that he reads this publication.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: During his capture, Kovacs assaulted and severely injured at least nine police officers, shooting one officer with a grappling gun. That officer is in serious but stable condition.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORMAN
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, in Kashmir, fighting continues to intensify. Both India and Pakistan alluded that the use of nuclear weapons is not out of the question-- Laurie shuts off the TV, not wanting to hear the war talk

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: That mask's eaten Rorschach's brains away.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He wasn't always like that. We were a great team--tactically, he was brilliant. But I don't know, something about this murder charge I just can't see Rorschach shooting Moloch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: He shot a cop with a grappling gun.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Don't remind me, I made that thing for him. But a regular gun just seems too . ordinary

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: And this war, god. Sometimes I wish I could just leave the planet. Like Jon.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh sure. The old Manhattan Transfer.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Now, that's funny. That's what you call Jon's teleportation?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Well, not to his face. Laurie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach walks, led by TWO CORRECTIONAL OFFICERS. From t cells, PRISONERS shout insults, death threats. Rorschach stares ahead. Silent. Calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRISON PSYCHIATRIST, Black, amiable, a mite portly, s across the table from Rorschach sans mask: Cold and frightening. The Psychiatrist reads his FILE.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: Walter Kovacs. Is that your name? Walter?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: No. The Psychiatrist sits back, considering Rorschach careful

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: Let me explain your situation here, Walter. If you cooperate with me, I may be able to convince them that you should to be treated medically, in a hospital, which I believe is best for you. But the authorities want to put you in General Population. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: A prison is a prison.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: Yes, but the difference is, downstairs? They'll eat you alive. He holds up a RORSCHACH BLOT-CARD.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now . . tell me what you see. FLASH OF: A DEAD DOG. Bloody, horrible.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: A pretty butterfly. The Psychiatrist holds up another blot-card.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: How about this one? What do you see here? FLASH OF: Rorschach, as a LITTLE BOY, watching his MOTHER HALF NAKED, EMBRACE A MAN AS HE HANDS HER SOME MONEY. Whe she catches Rorschach interrupting, she SMACKS him in the face. Shuts the door on him.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Some nice flowers. The Psychiatrist eyes him, dubious. Holds up another card FLASH OF: Rorschach as a little boy looking up at TWO OLD BOYS, teasing him. Calling him "son of a whore." Rorschac just wants to be left alone when one of the Boys SPITS in face. Suddenly, Rorschach's face changes. He attacks the like a wild animal--biting, clawing .

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Clouds. The Psychiatrist sighs, puts the cards down.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: Tell me about Rorschach. Will you do that?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Why are you here with me, doctor?

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: Because I want to make you well. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: There's other men in here with behavior more extreme than mine. Of course, they're not famous. You want to know about Rorschach, doctor? I'll tell you about Rorschach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach, walks through intermittent STREETLIGHTS. In hi GLOVE, he holds a PHOTO of an angelic SIX YEAR OLD GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was investigating a kidnap case. Blair Roche, 6 year old girl. I was young then. Too soft on criminals. I let them live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A creepy, deserted-looking house. Rorschach peers through slatted fence at TWO GERMAN SHEPHERDS FIGHTING.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Broke a man's arm to get a tip. Led me to the missing girl's location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! The front door is KICKED OPEN, smashing the lock. Rorschach moves between a line of headless MANNEQUINS. In corner rests an old WOOD-BURNING STOVE. Rorschach peers inside, removes a BLACKENED scrap of UNDERWEAR. It's decorated with little hearts and bears.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I knew the girl was here. But when I searched the place I found nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach enters the kitchen. Out the window, the DOGS ar fighting. Rorschach opens a cupboard, where a line of KNI CLEAVERS and a HACKSAW hang on hooks. Outside, the snarli dogs get LOUDER. Slowly now, Rorschach's gaze moves from the knives . to the counter. He runs his gloved finger along RED STAINED, DEEP-CUT GROOVES in a THICK WOODEN CHOPPING BLOCK. Blood. gaze continues out the window

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And then I found her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: . to the dogs, still fighting over the BONE, which we now recognize as a small, HUMAN FEMUR--that of the little gir Rorschach clenches his hands in fury, his fists tremble and suddenly, he relaxes. Calms. Rorschach slowly turns to the cupboard. He reaches for a large CLEAVER .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHILD MOLESTER, greasy and fat, walks past the now-si fence.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was dark when the murderer got back. As dark as it gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man flicks a LIGHT SWITCH. Nothing. He draws a GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries the light in here. Nothing again. He turns away the BODY of a DEAD GERMAN SHEPARD CRASHES THROUGH THE WIN He SCRAMBLES through the warehouse, falling over mannequi He FIRES madly into the dark. The SECOND DOG SMASHES INTO FROM A SECOND WINDOW. His gun goes flying. He scrambles backward against the stove. FROM BEHIND, Rorschach CUFFS THE MAN'S WRIST TO THE STOVE When the Child Molester sees that "face," he loses his bladder. Rorschach just stares, mask-blots shifting

dialogues.speaker: CHILD MOLESTER
dialogues.text: You think I had something to do with that girl? I didn't! Where's your evidence? Rorschach calmly points to body of the dog. (It is the same image Rorschach saw in the first blot-card.)

dialogues.speaker: CHILD MOLESTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I confess! I kidnapped her! I killed her! Arrest me!

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Men get arrested. Rorschach RAISES THE CLEAVER, high over his head (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RORSCHACH (cont'd) Dogs get put down. Rorschach SWINGS the cleaver DOWN. Blood SPATTERS his mas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Psychiatrist listens, paralyzed. Horrified.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: A tremor of impact shook my arm. Warm blood splashed my face. It was Walter Kovacs who screamed, who closed his eyes-- it was Rorschach who opened them again. The silence reels out RORSCHACH (cont'd) You see, Doctor. God didn't kill that little girl, fate didn't butcher her and destiny didn't feed her to those dogs. If God saw what any of us did that night, he didn't seem to mind. From then on, I knew. God doesn't make the world this way. We do. The Psychiatrist rises shakily. He crosses to the GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
dialogues.text: I can't help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mess hall is PACKED, hundreds of INMATES eat dinner. Rorschach enters. The place goes instantly, heavily SILEN Suddenly someone yells:

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey Rorschach, I heard your momma was a whore! A cruel RIPPLE OF LAUGHTER and the mass conversation begi again as Rorschach takes his place in the food line. A HU PRISONER moves in behind him. He whispers:

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: Hey, Rorschach. You're pretty famous, right? Y'know, I'm pretty famous too. Maybe I can give you my autograph. The Prisoner slides a SHIV from his sleeve (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rorschach doesn't register this. He waits for the FRY-COO behind the counter to turn away-- --then casually reaches across and lifts the DEEP-FRYER BASKET from its mount-- --the Prisoner JABS the shiv forward--Rorschach spins, GRIPPING the man's wrist and FLINGING the BOILING GREASE THE MAN'S FACE. The man SHRIEKS like a FIRE WHISTLE and CRASHES TO THE GROUND. The Guards DESCEND on Rorschach. Rorschach is calm as he's dragged away. As the injured ma screams fall away to weak, bubbling hitches, the room onc again goes silent. Rorschach eyes the fearful, hateful ey of the room, marking each one. And in the silence he spea his icy voice carrying easily.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: None of you understand. I'm not locked up in here with you. Rorschach is placidly dragged off INTO DARKNESS

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're locked up in here with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THE NITE-OWL UNIFORM, staring its blank, empty stare. Laurie stares back, alone down here, fascinated wi the costume, the gadgets, the whole place. She wanders to OWL-SHIP, whose tarp has been pulled back. She runs her finger through the DUST caked on the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the ship, Laurie pulls open a HATCH filled with ALTERNATE COSTUMES; designed for underwater work, cold conditions, heavy armor. She puts a cigarette in her mout

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: All these gadgets and there isn't even a dash lighter She hits a BUTTON--the lights inside go DIM. Creepy. She the button again to turn the lights back on but nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan returns home with some TAKE OUT FOOD . . when he hear Laurie SCREAM downstairs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Laurie?! Dan BOLTS for the basement door, thoughts of the mask-kil on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan descends the stairs and sees FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Dan grabs a FIRE EXTINGUISHER.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you?! Dan SPRAYS the fire. Laurie stumbles from the smoke, out the Owl-Ship. Dan's got the fire under control now.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry--I hit the wrong button. I was looking for the lighter in.there.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don't smoke. Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I'm fine, but your ship--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Ah, that's mostly just soot. Archie's pretty resilient.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Archie?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short for Archimedes--Merlin's owl. I'm just glad you're okay. I heard you scream and well, you know, after the Comedian--

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Still with the mask-killer theory? Rorschach is insane.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Maybe, but the Comedian murdered; Jon exiled; Someone tries to shoot Adrian; Rorschach gets arrested. It makes me uneasy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan goes to a BANK OF SWITCHES on the wall. Flicking them the Owl-Chamber LIGHTS UP. Hidden FANS dissipate the smok

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: How did you ever afford all this?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: My Dad was in corporate banking. He left me quite a bit. Which always surprised me.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: How did he die?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Mugging. He was shot. As Dan cleans up, Laurie watches him, like she's seeing h for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You really do worry about me, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Huh? Well, yeah, of course I worry about you, I mean, we're, y'know, friends-- Laurie takes off his glasses . and KISSES him. It's what Dan's been wanting all this time . but he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, I

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: What's wrong? But Dan is already walking up the stairs, pathetic. Lauri left there, alone. The Owl-Costume looming in the backgro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach sits in his cell, staring impassively at the wa

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's been a long time, Rorschach. Rorschach turns to see TWO THUGS standing side by side, o muscle bound, the other very fat, staring at him through bars. PAN DOWN: To reveal a MIDGET between them--the supervillain known as the BIG FIGURE--his silver hair com neatly back, a big CIGAR perched in his tiny mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Big Figure. Small world.

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE
dialogues.text: (chuckles through smoke) I like that. But you know, it is a small world in here. I've been in it for--how long now, Billy?

dialogues.speaker: DUMB THUG
dialogues.text: Twenty years, Mr. Figure.

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE
dialogues.text: That's right. Twenty years since you and that owl fella put me away. Rorschach-- that guy you burned is dying. Could go any minute now. And when he does, this place is gonna explode. Then you die by inches.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Tall order.

dialogues.speaker: FAT THUG
dialogues.text: (SLAMS into the bars) I'm gonna tear this guy a new hole!

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE
dialogues.text: Relax, Lloyd. Soon. Chuckling, Big Figure walks off down the long, shadowed corridor. Rorschach continues staring, straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Dan, naked, on his knees in the center of an INFINITE FIELD OF BLACKNESS. No corners, no exits. In the DISTANCE, he sees a FEMALE FORM. Desperate, he runs to he It's Laurie, waiting for him IN COSTUME. They kiss. She t at him passionately. His SKIN suddenly TEARS AWAY like wrapping paper. Beneath the false skin, Dan wears his NIT OWL COSTUME. Confident, he touches her face. She smiles w palpable heat. They kiss. In the background, a NUCLEAR BLAST ERUPTS. Still kissing, BLAST BLOWS THEM INTO TWO EMBRACING SKELETONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan wakes with a jolt, sweat beaded on his forehead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR opens. Laurie stands in the SHAFT OF LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Dan? Is everything okay? I heard you coming down the stairs Descending the stairs, she finds Dan before his costume, naked. He fiddles with an OWL-WING THROWING WEAPON.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Mask killers. War. Nuclear annihilation. I feel so powerless, so I've been afraid of this damn costume. Afraid of how much I need it. He FLINGS the owl wing crescent, whizzing into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: So. Let's take the ship out.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Who's to know? I used to be a "masked avenger" too, remember? I'm used to getting up at three in the morning to do something stupid. Besides, I'm already a wanted lady, you're already in trouble for hiding me, how much more trouble can we be in? Just give me a second--can't go out like this. She jogs upstairs. Dan turns to the empty, waiting suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP: DAN'S COSTUMED BODY. The Nite Owl suit is fantast intricate, but above the belly . it just barely fits, Dan managing to CLICK it closed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I can't believe it still fits. Luckily I constructed it with material that was elastic and-- Dan turns as Laurie appears at the door, decked in her BL SPANDEX. SILK SPECTRE, looking every bit as good as seven

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --form fitting (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I'm ready. Dan turns and sees his reflection in the owl-Ship's windo

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie holds on as the Owl-Ship's ENGINES ROAR to life. T ship RISES INTO THE AIR and slips easily into the TUNNEL. Laurie watches the LIGHTS of the tunnel whiz by. At the e two big STEEL DOORS open, allowing a passage UP.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Let's have some cloud cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THICK FOG POURS FROM LOWER-DECK JETS as the ship RISES in an ABANDONED WAREHOUSE, whose steel roof ROLLS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie touches the window, the SPARKLING CITY laid out be

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: It's so beautiful

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hang on. Dan BANKS, wheeling the ship toward the VELDT BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got to clean her up a bit. I'm sure Adrian wouldn't want to impede the course of justice. Heading straight for the building, Dan JIGS at the last moment, flying the ship THROUGH THE V-SHAPED WATERFALL in skyscraper's center. The water washes clean the years of dust. The Owl-Ship emerges, sparkling like new.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Look! Below, a TENEMENT BUILDING is ENGULFED IN FLAME. Dan's ja sets. He wheels the ship around and down. As they zoom closer, they can see people SCREAMING from the windows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's children in there!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I'm putting the water cannons on the lower stories. (over the LOUDSPEAKERS)

dialogues.speaker: YOU.
dialogues.text: (to Laurie) Can you escort the people over? She watches him move, quick, confident. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I'm on it. Nite Owl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship EXTENDS AN ESCAPE RAMP with Laurie on board. The residents forget their fear of fire for a moment as they in the spectacle of this sexy lady on this Owl-Ship.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Hi. If you could all form a line, we'll have you out of here in just a moment. ATOP THE SHIP: Dan latches the steering column into its r socket. He stands; Takes a deep, chest-expanding breath. has he been kidding? This is who he is. Flicking a switch JAZZ plays pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below, the residents file on board, in a daze at their surroundings. Laurie grins at the music.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Anybody want coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE rising behind, Dan wings the ship STRAIGHT INTO FRAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship RISES, leaving a grateful CROWD behind. In t background FIRE TRUCKS are just arriving. A FIREFIGHTER l up in time to see the Owl-Ship disappear into the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan skims the clouds like a man waking from a dream.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I can't believe we did that! That was actually fun

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. He puts a hand on her shoulder. His eyes locked onto hers knows what he wants and this time he's not afraid of it He kisses her. Hard. Running her hands up his cheeks, the slide each other's masks off. Their mouths melt together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft music plays. Dan and Laurie lie in a heap of discard costumes.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: It was good, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, saving those people from the fire. Taking Archie out Laurie swats him on the chest--that's not what she meant. grins, having fun with her.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It--you were unbelievable. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: So . what do we do next? Dan sits up, serious. Very serious.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about that. And I believe we have certain obligations to our fraternity. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should spring Rorschach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat. The ship hovers, silent in the clouds. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prisoner Rorschach burned lies in bed, his face completely bandaged, hooked to an IV . . when he FLATLINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the dark corridors, a ROAR is building. ALARMS ring. Figure and his two Thugs appear at the door.

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE
dialogues.text: He's dead, Rorschach--the riot's already begun. While everyone's distracted, we thought we'd bring you a housewarming gift. Something from the machine shop. The Fat Thug wheels an ELECTRICAL WELDER to the door. Rorschach sits, idly TEARING his PRISON SHIRT into STRIPS

dialogues.speaker: FAT THUG
dialogues.text: Hey Boss, y'notice? None of that "small world, tall order" crap, cuz he knows once we slice open this lock, he's next on the block.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Fat chance. The Fat Thug reddens. He DIVES forward, HANDS SWIPING for Rorschach.

dialogues.speaker: FAT THUG
dialogues.text: You're dead, Rorschach! We got a prison full of killers out here! What've you got? Rorschach SPINS, WRAPPING A SHIRT-STRIP AROUND HIS WRISTS trapping the Fat Thug's hands inside the cell.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Your hands. My pleasure. Rorschach SNAPS Fat Thug's pinky fingers. Fat Thug SHRIEK Rorschach roughly binds the fingers around the bars. Dumb Thug tries to reach the welder around Fat Thug's bod

dialogues.speaker: DUMB THUG
dialogues.text: I can't reach the lock. Should I cut the bars? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE
dialogues.text: This riot won't last. And I've been waiting twenty years for this Big Figure nods to the Dumb Thug, who then grabs Fat Thug neck.

dialogues.speaker: DUMB THUG
dialogues.text: Nothing personal, big guy.

dialogues.speaker: FAT THUG
dialogues.text: Boss, you can't be serious! Wait-- Dumb Thug SNAPS Fat Thug's neck. He then CUTS OFF Fat Thu hands with the welder, pushes the corpse out of the way t reach the lock. Big Figure grins at Rorschach.

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE
dialogues.text: Now you find out what the score is.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: One-nothing. Come and get me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Laurie are back in costume.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Look, Dan, I'm glad you were able to rediscover your calling in life, but I think you're getting carried away. You're talking about springing a homicidal psychopath from prison.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach may be sick, but I think he's on to something--four heroes attacked in a week is not a coincidence. I mean, that whole cancer thing with ion, does that make sense to you? You didn't contract cancer from him. He says as Laurie's about to light a cigarette. She chang her mind.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Why would someone want to drive ion away? Look what's happening now. With Jon gone it looks like we're headed for another World War. Who would want that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE THE WINDOW: The Owl-Ship approaches a ROOFTOP wit HELIPAD. On the helipad is a HELICOPTER with the Veidt Enterprises LOGO.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I know someone who might be able to help. Dan lands the Owl-Ship on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprisingly, Adrian is awake, packing his things, hustli about his grand mansion as Dan and Laurie trail.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're leaving town? So you do believe Rorschach's theory.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Please. Right now, I'm not concerned with this so-called mask-killer, I'm concerned with the mass killer called war, or have you not heard. (calling out) On ! A WALL SIZED MIRROR turns into a TV:

dialogues.speaker: CNN NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: --US Aircraft Carriers have already moved into the Persian Gulf and US Battleships have left Japan en route to the Far East

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: It's happening Dan breaks away from the terrible news, follows Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: All the more reason we need to get to the bottom of this. Maybe we can get Jon to come back in the process and stop all this madness.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Nothing we do will bring Jon back! (glances at Laurie) But I think you know that already. And breaking Rorschach out of prison certainly isn't the answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach's been the only one investigating this from the start. Without him, we're starting at the beginning and we don't have that kind of time. We need your help, Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm leaving, Dan. And I suggest you both do the same. Adrian pulls on a thick WINTER COAT and heads upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian walks briskly to his idling COPTER, propellers lou cutting through the air. Dan gives one last effort, shout

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Where are you going to go?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Antarctica. It takes Dan a moment to realize Adrian is serious. By th Adrian's halfway into the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good luck, Dan. He says it sincerely. Dan watches the helicopter fly off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumb Thug WELDS, the lock GLOWS RED. Nearly through. Rorschach backs away from the door as Big Figure trembles excitement.

dialogues.speaker: BIG FIGURE
dialogues.text: Hurry Lloyd! I wanna smell this sonofabitch cooking! The lock MELTS AWAY. Rorschach climbs onto his bunk as Du Thug enters, JABBING the electric welder at him menacingl Rorschach drives his HEEL into the porcelain TOILET BOWL, SHATTERING IT. WATER SPILLS across the floor. Rorschach K Dumb Thug in the stomach; Dumb Thug buckles, then SLIPS i the water--Dumb Thug falls, welder still in hand as he hi the water Dumb Thug's hand FUSES to the welder as ELECTRICITY SURGE THROUGH HIM. He collapses, smoking. Dead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Hmm. Never disposed of sewage with a toilet before. Obvious, really. Big Figure looks very small and alone now

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two-nothing. Your move. Panic stricken, Big Figure moves, or rather, runs. Rorsch calmly follows him out of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship tears through the sky, the prison ahead on t horizon. Dan has his game face on; Laurie's still unsure.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this. I know the whole crimefighting thing wasn't necessarily your choice in life.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: No. But this is. She moves next to him.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I'm not doing it for Rorschach or even for Jon. And I'm sure as hell not doing if for the Comedian. They look at each other--Dan knows who she's doing it for The Owl-Ship is upon the prison now

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look! They see a RIOT below--Inmates spilling out into the yard overwhelming the Correctional Officers on the ground; TOW GUARDS take shots at some of the Inmates; Broken glass, broken furniture parts scattered through the yard; SMOKE emits from inside the prison.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hmm, Rorschach gets locked up in here and suddenly there's a riot. I wonder if that's a coincidence. They descend toward the hell of TEAR-GAS, FIRE and VIOLEN The Tower Guards, stunned at the sight of the Owl-Ship, b SHOOTING at it. The bullets bounce right off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put your ear-plugs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship emits a PIERCING SHRIEK. WINDOWS SHATTER. The Inmates and Guards fall to the ground in sonic agony.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: How are we going to find Rorschach in all of this?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: When he and I were partners, we each had tracking implants put under our skin so old Archie here could find us if either one of us were ever in trouble. Let's see if Rorschach kept his in. Dan turns on the GPS monitor. There's a BLIP on the scree

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's in that wing. Dan steers the ship toward the Maximum Security Wing. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship stops to a hover position. The LOWER HATCH O and a LADDER extends As Laurie descends the ladder, Dan simply, joyously LEAPS OUT, his wings SNAP WIDE to GLIDE him through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fires burn in the cells. Shotguns and screams echo in the emergency lighting. Archie's Owl-Shriek is dulled here--i quiet. Tense. Laurie and Dan turn the corner, searching. Laurie spots t BODY of a DEAD GUARD. She crouches to take his PISTOL, sl it into her waistband.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: How do we know he's still alive? They come upon Rorschach's cell. Dan sees the SMOKING COR of Dumb Thug. Sees the CUT OFF HANDS of Fat Thug, HANGING from the bars. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Figure runs, turns a corner, ducking into the BATHROO Rorschach sees this and walks serenely after him . when Dan and Laurie enter the far hall.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Is that--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach? Rorschach!

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Hello, Daniel, Ms. Jupiter. Excuse me, I just have to visit the men's room. He disappears into the dark bathroom. Laurie watches afte him in stunned disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, it happens. I remember I lost a big arrest like that once. Had to redesign the costume after that-- Rorschach exits the bathroom, wiping his hands.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: We can leave now. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're ready? We don't want to go diving head-first into things.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Good Advice. I'm sure there are many who'd agree with you. Behind them: BLOODY WATER FLOODS from the bathroom door a they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio crosses the roof as Dan calls Archie by REMOTE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Good to see you in uniform, Daniel. What happened? Finally taking the mask-killer seriously?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Of course you haven't been attacked yet. Funny, most everyone else has.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean? We came here to rescue you, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Survive now! Argue later! I had to turn the screechers off, so we'll be drawing fire. The owl-Ship rises to the roof. They all jump in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under HEAVY FIRE the Owl-Ship ZOOMS OFF, leaving the chao behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan weaves and whips the ship into the sky, above the clo Satisfied that they've escaped, Dan allows himself a grin looks at Laurie, who grins back.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach, you remember how to handle Archie?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: I believe so. Rorschach sits in the pilot's seat. Dan turns to Laurie, on adrenaline and love. Dan moves in to kiss her--

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Give us a second--

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: I don't think this can wait. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What? What is it Dan looks up, through the windshield, and sees-- --Dr. Manhattan WALKING ACROSS THE CLOUDS--STRAIGHT FOR T SHIP.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: It `s him. The ship COLLIDES with Dr. Manhattan, who PASSES THROUGH the CABIN with a SHOWER of BLUE PARTICLES--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Hello Laurie.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: They said you were on Mars.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I am on Mars. You and I are about to have a conversation there.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Where? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: You are going to try to convince me to save the world.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Wait, what? You're taking her to Mars? No, she can't--Laurie, I don't know about

dialogues.speaker: THIS
dialogues.text: Laurie looks at Dan then at Dr. Manhattan. Comprehending

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I have to go, Dan. Jon and I, we're going to talk. Maybe we'll find some way out of this mess the world's gotten itself in. I'll be okay. Really.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE--
dialogues.text: Laurie and Dr. Manhattan BURST INTO PARTICLES--they're go Dan stares at the space where Laurie just was.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: No time for heartbreak, Daniel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan notes TWO BLIPS on the RADAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO NYPD HELICOPTERS appear behind the Owl-Ship INSIDE THE OWL SHIP: Dan takes the controls.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Let's try and lose them in the city. He hits the jets, heading for the New York SKYLINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red vista. Dr. Manhattan and Laurie appear atop a rise.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: So. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: J--huc? Hhhhhhh-- Laurie GRIPS her throat and TUMBLES down the hill. She ro into Jon, waiting for her at the bottom. She CLAWS at him

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Forgive me. These things sometimes slip my mind. He TOUCHES her mouth, forming a small ATMOSPHERE around h She HEAVES in air, retching and choking at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Jon, you stupid bastard! Listen, you better not forget this air supply or whatever it is (looking up) Oh shit. Laurie stands up before Jon's huge GLASS PALACE.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm on Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship WEAVES around the buildings, trying to shake copters . but the pilots are good, staying on its tail. The Owl-Ship shoots out of the city over the water . Dan LOOPS Archie around-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --and heads straight for a SUBWAY TUNNEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . just clearing it. The Owl-Ship SKIMS the sides of the tunnel, SPARKS flying-- --when a SUBWAY appears. They're heading straight for it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: oh no.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Tactical error, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know-- They head straight for the subway-- --when the tunnel opens up-- --Dan SWERVES to the adjacent track just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship emerges from the subway tunnel . when one of the NYPD copters cuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Shit. Dan accelerates, weaving Archie around the skyscrapers, t Empire State Building . but the copter's still there. Dan cuts around the UNITED NATIONS BUILDING. The copter follows the Owl-Ship around to the East River . but the Owl-Ship is nowhere to be found The copter hovers there. Baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship rests at the bottom of the river, hidden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of GANG MEMBERS (with the black and yellow bandan who confronted Dan on the subway earlier in the film) wal down the block when another Gang Member catches up, runni (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 1
dialogues.text: Yo, y'all hear? Some super owl dude broke Rorschach outta prison.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: Rorschach? That fool put my cousin in a

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 2
dialogues.text: You say Nite Owl broke him out? Didn't he write a book or something? He lives over a garage near here.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: Does he now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollis sits up in bed, TV on: CNN; Grainy, shaky CLIPS of Owl-Ship. He's on the phone, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: It's just like old times, Sal. Nite Owl and Silk Spectre back at it again. CUT TO: Sally Jupiter on the other end in California, watching the same footage.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: I always knew Laurie had it in her. Sorry for waking you, Hollis.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS
dialogues.text: I may be retired from the costume, but my sleeping habits have never changed. There's a KNOCK at Hollis's door.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who--there's someone at the door. It might be Dan and Laurie--they may need help. I better go. Hollis hangs up, heads to the door, excited. He opens the

dialogues.speaker: DOOR--
dialogues.text: --and the Gang Members PILE INTO HIM. The picture SLOWS D Hollis turns, mouth bleeding. HOLLIS' POV IS SEPIA TONED. gang appears as a COLLECTION of VILLAINS in COSTUMES. SLOW, SEPIA: A young Hollis is in his old COSTUME. The VO come from the present, while Hollis is lost in the past. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In his SLO-MO world, Hollis PASTES at Villain in the mout in reality, he gets nailed. This intercutting continues u the Gang Leader picks up the GOLD STATUE of Hollis in cos whose base reads: IN GRATITUDE

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 1
dialogues.text: Hold on, Derf, are you sure this is the right guy--he, he's just an old man.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: Then I'm probably doing him a favor. Hollis, old again, looks up. The SHADOW of the statue DESCENDS HARD TOWARD HIS FACE--GO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship moves slowly through the water.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: I hate this. How long are we going to stay down here? Daniel! Dan says nothing. Rorschach puts on his costume.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're letting fear paralyze you. And that woman--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey! We took enough unnecessary risks bringing Archie up so you could get your spare costume. We stay put until it cools down out there--they're looking for us.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Unnecessary? Cowering in the sludge, from the authorities, that's unnecessary. Rorschach pulls his mask on, turns.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: While we waste time, the mask-killer gets closer. We need to get to Pyramid Industries. Dan sits at the COMPUTER.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I know, you told me already. I'm tapping into all the databases, finding out about the company-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Sitting at a computer? No. We need to trace the killer--hit up underworld contacts, squeeze people. You've forgotten how we do things. You've been lazing around too long.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Listen, I HAVE HAD IT! Who the hell do you think you are? You live off people while insulting them, and no one complains because they think you're a goddamn lunatic! Dan turns away, shaking. He leans against the console.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that. Maybe you're right, maybe--

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Dan turns. Rorschach holds out an open hand.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are a good friend. I'm sorry that it is sometimes difficult with me. Touched, Dan shakes his hand. An awkward, lovely moment.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey forget it It's okay, man. Releasing his hand with some effort, Dan sits, invigorate

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're right. It's time to head up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship BURSTS THROUGH THE SURFACE OF THE WATER

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Let's really start plumbing the depths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon leads Laurie into the Glass Palace. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Our conversation commences when you surprise me with the information that you and Dreiberg have been sleeping together.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You . know about me and Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Not yet. But in a few moments, you're going to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Jon, I'm having enough problems right now without getting into your predestination crap.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Why does my perception of time distress you so?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Because. If you already know the future, why were you surprised when I left you, or when that reporter ambushed you? Why even debate if you already know the outcome?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Because everything is pre-ordained. Even my responses.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Agh! This is so typical of you! Do you know what a relief it is to be with somebody human, like Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: You mean you're sleeping with Dan Dreiberg? Contemplating this, he steps to the balcony's edge.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: But you already know . You said--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I said, often, that you were my only remaining link with the world. Now that link is shattered. Don't you see the futility of asking me to save a world that I no longer have any stake in? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous. The Earth is too important to hinge on one relationship.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Not to me. My red world here means more to me than your blue one. I'll show you around if you like. The giant Glass Palace begins to RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Are you doing this? I'm not in the mood for jokes.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Nor I. Believe me, I fully understand the gravity of the situation. The clockwork Glass Palace RISES HIGH INTO THE AIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship approaches the large warehouse building that Pyramid Industries. The ship lands in the alley nearby. Dan and Rorschach exit the ship. Shady neighborhood. Rorschach goes to the door which is AJAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Rorschach slowly make their way down, peering int ROOMS. The place looks abandoned--scattered papers, dusty file cabinets, leftover computer components

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: You sure this is the correct location, Daniel?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Positive. Pyramid Industries. Specializes in industrial plastics. At least they did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the large, dark industrial section of the building. They pass huge PROCESSING VATS, CONVEYOR BELTS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I tapped into all the databases--tax records, business registries, real estate records--trying to get a bead on who's behind Pyramid but it's a never ending paper trail. Rorschach investigates ahead when Dan catches some MOVEME --he turns his FLASHLIGHT to find a few HOMELESS PEOPLE squatting in the warehouse. Upon seeing Dan in.costume, t Homeless People run away.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They're harmless, Rorschach.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Daniel. Rorschach is looking down at something. Dan heads over an sees a DEAD BODY in the early stages of decomposition. He turns the body over--bullet between the eyes just like Mo . but we recognize the corpse--it's journalist Doug Roth.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hey, I know this man.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Yes. Doug Roth. Journalist who grilled Dr. Manhattan on national television.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No I didn't watch that interview. This was the guy who was doing a story on Adrian when I went to see him.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Hmm. Journalist set up Dr. Manhattan, was probably working to set up Veidt also. Dan stands there thinking. As if hit with an epiphany. He opens his mouth like he can't believe what he's going to

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach. What, what if it's Adrian?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Veidt? Behind everything? Makes no sense. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: On the surface it doesn't, but hear me out--Adrian's the only one who could've taken on the Comedian in hand to hand combat. He's the only one with the finances to create an entire company for the sole purpose of setting up Dr. Manhattan. And Adrian was directly involved in arranging that broadcast. He probably supplied this journalist with the whole cancer list.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: That doesn't explain the attempt on Veidt's life.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: If we say that Adrian set that up himself, he could've had the hitman shoot his assistant first. It was a risk, but--

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. Let's go ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The endless white blanket that is Antarctica is interrupt by a SPLASH OF COLOR in the distance. As we approach, we that the color is a BIO-DOME--a tropical RAINFOREST insid This is part of KARNAK: Adrian Veidt's Arctic Fortress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian stands at the entrance of the Bio-Dome, amidst the exotic foliage, where a GROUP of SCIENTISTS and ENGINEERS gathered. They all hold CHAMPAGNE FLUTES--Adrian raises h glass for a toast when the HEAD SCIENTIST interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Mr. Veidt, may I?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: By all means, Eric.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: I just would like to say that when I was first offered this position, I was hesitant. A multi-year commitment to work in Antarctica? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HEAD SCIENTIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But the opportunity to experiment with Dr. Manhattan's atomic fusion energy was too great for me to pass up, too great for any of us to pass up. And now that our work is finished, and we finally get to go home, I can say that it was all worth it. Mr. Veidt, you are a genius. The world will be a better place because of you.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I certainly hope so. The group applauds. Then they sip their champagne. All ex for Adrian The group goes around congratulating each other, when suddenly the Head Scientist COLLAPSES, choking. The other surround him, trying to help-- --when one by one they each start collapsing themselves-- POISONED by the champagne. Adrian regards them all, writhing on the floor, and leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the alley, the Gang Members who killed Hollis Mason st around the Owl-Ship arguing amongst themselves, when Dan appears behind them.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Something I can help you with, boys? They all spin around, frightened at the costume.

dialogues.speaker: GANG MEMBER 1
dialogues.text: (to Gang Leader) I told you we had the wrong guy. The Gang Leader shits his pants as Dan steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: GANG LEADER
dialogues.text: L-listen, I didn't mean to kill that old guy. Things just got outta hand

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What old guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing SCREAMS outside, Rorschach bursts out of the

dialogues.speaker: WAREHOUSE--
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --and sees Dan gripping the bloody Gang Leader by the THR CHOKING him as the other Gang Members flee.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You're dead! You and the rest of your gang, you're all DEAD! You know how much fire-power I've got floating out there!? Oh god damn. Hollis. God damn god damn god damn Dan begins to break up. Rorschach quietly pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Not now, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship slows to a hover besides an OLDER BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rorschach's Journal. Final entry? Dreiberg is convinced that Veidt is behind everything. Apparently, the Owl- Ship is capable of the trip to Antarctica, but are we? I cannot imagine a more dangerous opponent. Veldt is faster than Dreiberg and myself. He used to joke that he was fast enough to catch a bullet. I believe he could. He could kill us both, alone in' the snow. No one would know. Rorschach descends the ladder, goes to the door of the building. He places his JOURNAL in an ENVELOPE.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I have done my best to make this legible. Whether I am alive or dead upon this reading, know that whatever the nature of this conspiracy--Adrian Veldt is responsible. He drops the envelope into the MAIL SLOT, climbs back up ladder.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I appreciate your recent support and hope the world survives long enough for this to reach you. For my own part, I regret nothing. I have lived my life free of compromise, and step now into the shadow without complaint. Rorschach. October 21st. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rorschach disappears into the dark hatch. The Owl-Ship bl off . disappearing, just as Seymour arrives. Seymour picks up the mail and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Editor walks in as Seymour goes through the mail.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: SEYMOUR! Is that Dulmage's editorial cartoon?

dialogues.speaker: SEYMOUR
dialogues.text: It's the mail. Hey cool, someone sent us their journal. (READING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Earlier today I came across what appeared to be a suicide. It was later learned to be a homicide. Someone's time was up."

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: War's coming, Seymour--I don't wanna hear some knob's life story! Chuck it in the crank file! Seymour tosses Rorschach's journal into a PILE OF LETTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie's hair blows in the cold wind. She lowers her head Jon serves her some WATER.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Can't you just tell me how this all ends and save us the trouble?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: It ends with you in tears.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Tears. You mean I lose? You don't come back to Earth?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I return to Earth at some point. The streets are filled with death.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You mean there's going to be a war? An actual, nuclear war? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I can't be sure. I'm still experiencing some static interference preventing any clear vision of what lies ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Static?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Tachyon particles. Tachyons are a rare occurrence. The detonation of nuclear warheads could conceivably be the cause.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Jon, you've got to stop it! Everyone will die!

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: And the universe will not even notice. See the dual moons. Aren't they breathtaking? Above, TWO MOONS cross overhead. One is HUGE, CRIMSON RED the smaller is a delicate SHELL PINK. Spectacular.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: You're right, Jon--what does human life matter next to a, a neutrino. Look, I'm not going to debate you when you clearly don't see anything terribly miraculous about life. I guess quantum physics doesn't allow for miracles.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: No, thermodynamic miracles are--

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Oh God, Jon. Land this thing. Now.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: On the Argyre Planitia? As you wish. The structure descends. Laurie stomps down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: That's it then. You can send me back to Earth to fry with Dan and my Mom and all the other worthless humans. And look, you were wrong. You said this ended with me in tears and see? Not a damp eye in the house. Maybe you're wrong about everything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon is waiting for her at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Laurie. You complain that I refuse to see life on life's terms. And yet you continuously refuse to see things from my perspective. If only you'd try to see the whole continuum, life's pattern, you'd understand. But you deliberately shut it out as if afraid to see.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid, okay? You want me to see things your way? Go ahead, do that thing you do. She stands there, arms folded, waiting. Then, just like earlier in the lab, Jon touches her head--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same flashback as before, in Laurie's childhood home. We' in Laurie's POV, as a little girl. There's arguing downstairs. Laurie goes down to investigate. She comes upon the kitchen door, ajar. She can see her PARENTS inside, arguing .

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You wanted to hear it, so I'm telling you, okay?. Magic! Dreams! That's what I had before. I was a hero goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE'S FATHER
dialogues.text: It's not my fault you got old! What do you have to complain about?! I'm putting food on the table for you and your child. Why don't you give your friend Eddie a call? Maybe he can give you a better life!

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: It was a mistake--one time! Am I never-- And then they notice Laurie looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, Laurie (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tears run down little Laurie's face. Her parents are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Laurie breaks away from ion and drops down to her knees tears flowing.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: No. No, no, no, no not him

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: The comedian was your father.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: But he--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Attacked your mother. Yes. (searching in his mind) Two years later he came back to her, to make amends. And you were conceived on that day.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Laurie WHIPS a BOTTLE at the palace-- --and the huge glass construction CRUMBLES. Jon protects with a FORCE FIELD as debris collapses around them. Lauri sobs in the echoing SILENCE. Jon's eyes SHUT. He seems to feel . empathy. A TEAR slips down his cheek. Laurie's realization is a revelation for

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The comedian is my father. I guess my life is just one big joke.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I don't think your life is a joke.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Well, of course you're going to say that.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: But I've changed my mind. There are miracles in your world that are worth preserving.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: What? But you were saying-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I tried to explain. Thermodynamic miracles--events with odds against so astronomical, like oxygen turning into gold. I have longed to witness such a thing and yet I neglect that in human coupling, millions upon millions of cells compete to create life over generation after generation: Until finally, your mother loves a man--Edward Blake, the Comedian--a man she has every reason to hate. And out of that contradiction, against unfathomable odds, it was you, only you, that emerged. To distill so specific a form from all of that chaos; Your creation is like . turning air into gold. A miracle.
