dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: But if my birth is a miracle you, you could say that about anyone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, anyone in the world. But the world is so crowded with miracles that they become commonplace and we forget. I forget. They stand there in silence. Connected for the first time years.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. Dry your eyes. FROM ABOVE: We see the full CRATER--the ARGYRE PLANITIA. Round, with two, eye-like BOULDERS set side by side, a RI of land curling below . like a smiley-face.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The owl-Ship sails through a TOWERING CLOUD BANK. The COA approaches as SNOW starts to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan stares ahead, stoic. Thinking about Hollis, Laurie an Adrian. He glances at a MONITOR, tracking heat signatures There's a LARGE SIGNAL ahead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I've got a large reading ahead. Anything that's emitting that much heat out here, must be a pretty big facility. Adrian. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to make it, are we? Rorschach says nothing . when a halting WHINE sputters from the engines. A HUGE CLIFF APPEARS before them.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: The engines--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: They're icing up, hold on! Dan pulls the stick back. The ship SHUDDERS UPWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship, tiny before the massive ice-wall, climbs slowly It's going to be close. The wall is 100 yards away now, t top-most edge barely in view. 50 yards. 20 and then

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We just lost the engines--find something to grab on to! The ship BARELY CLEARS THE CLIFF. BOUNCING hard, it SKIPS across the snow like a stone, finally CRASHING INTO A DRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan opens the hatch. Shrieking WIND blows the snow in. Da pulls on a white, FUR-LINED SNOW-OWL costume.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The engines are de-icing. You sure I can't fit you with something warmer?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Fine like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rorschach pulls up his trench-collar against the bitter w Dan pulls two stand-up HOVER-SCOOTERS from an OUTSIDE HAT They exchange a look and ride the scooters off into the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian, dressed in his Ozymandias costume, sits alone in massive hall, opposite a wall of giant PLASMA-SCREENS whi show various television NEWS CHANNELS showing all the IMA OF WAR IN THE WORLD. Adrian sighs and hits the remote--the screens become ONE IMAGE--ALEXANDER THE GREAT slicing the Gordian Knot. By Adrian's feet is an exotic LYNX. Its unnatural beauty almost hides a feral danger in its eyes. Adrian pets the beast.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: See this painting? Alexander the Great. Before his conquest of Phoenicia, he struck North for Gordium, where the world's greatest puzzle waited. A great knot, impossible to untie. For a young man determined to rule the world, it was a challenge he couldn't resist. So he sliced it in two with his sword. Lateral thinking, you see. Suddenly the Lynx stands, GROWLS.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it, girl? He hits the remote--the TV screens switch to MULTIPLE VIE OF Dan and Rorschach, heading toward Karnak.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah. It's all right, girl. Everything's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying on the scooter, Dan wipes frost and fog from his goggles. He then looks up and-- --sees KARNAK, a GARGANTUAN GLASS PYRAMID, rising out of snow, the Bio-Dome attached to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian watches Dan and Rorschach reach the door on the monitors. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Really, getting even this far is an admirable effort, given their limitations. Of course the ice they're skating on is slippery and thinner than it looks. Let's hope they don't overstep themselves. On the monitors, Dan takes a LASER TORCH to the door.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's hope they know when to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having burnt through the control panel, Dan pushes the hu door open. They enter the grand palace, dwarfed by its Macedonian massiveness.

dialogues.speaker: JESUS
dialogues.text: (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand any of this. Adrian's a pacifist. He's never killed anyone in his life. He's a vegetarian for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Hitler was a vegetarian. If you're squeamish, leave him to me. We won't get a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Rorschach pass the wall of plasma screens into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the dining hall, where Adrian eats alone, at a long tab Though they're only a few yards away, Adrian doesn't appe to see them, hidden by some PILLARS. Dan and Rorschach signal to each other, quiet. Adrian eat --and Rorschach RUSHES him from behind-- --Adrian moves at the last second, grabs Rorschach's arm, ELBOWS him in the chest, spins and BACKHAND FISTS him, sending him flying back.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Mind your manners. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan draws his PEN-LASER.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Adrian, don't make me-- Adrian picks up a GOLDEN SERVING TRAY off the table as Da FIRES. Adrian DEFLECTS the laser with the tray-- --then DISCUS-SLINGS the tray into Dan's NOSE. Blood SPRA Dan drops to his knees. Adrian turns his back on them, ca

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Now. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You know! You killed the Comedian! You set up Rorschach! You created Pyramid Industries, hired all those people, gave them cancer and blamed it on Jon!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Dammit Adrian, what are you trying to do?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: What we always intended--to improve the world. As Adrian speaks, Rorschach sneaks up behind him, with a FORK. He tries to stab Adrian in the back, but Adrian effortlessly dodges the blow, GRABS Rorschach's mask, TWI it, then KNEES him in the gut. Rorschach drops to the flo Adrian starts walking out of the hall. Dan helps Rorschac and they follow.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never intended to kill the Comedian-- that was an accident. Part of his duties as a government operative was to keep track of all former masked heroes, make sure there was no rocking of the boat. He must have liked Rorschach because he allowed him to continue to exist. I had thought that the Comedian might be incompetent, but he disproved that hypothesis when he discovered what was really going on. here in Karnak--no easy task. Even my staff was unaware--I made sure to keep each department separate. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Comedian was appalled by my plan, but still, he understood the scope of what I was trying to accomplish. Frankly, I never thought he'd actually talk. But by the time he visited poor Moloch, he was cracking badly. So I had to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter the control hall, Rorschach moves to attack Adrian again when he and Dan hear a growl . the Lynx steps in between, protecting its master.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: After Blake, I neutralized Jon--a plan nearly a decade in the works after analyzing confidential psychological profiles which predicted his withdrawal from human existence. By then, Rorschach's mask theory, 'though erroneous, needed to be addressed, so I faked my own assassination--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Why take that risk? What if the hitman shot you first instead of your assistant?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I suppose I'd have to be fast enough to catch the bullet then, wouldn't I? Adrian smiles enigmatically.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After apprehending my own assassin, I shoved a cyanide capsule in his mouth, disposing of him, and soon after that, the journalist Doug Roth, tying up all the loose ends if you will. Then I knew nothing stood in the way of my triumph.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Triumph? Adrian, what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm firing a beam of concentrated energy, synthesized from Dr. Manhattan himself, into the hearts of nine key regions around the globe, crossing all traditional politics and ideologies; (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paris, Tehran, Kashmir, Beijing, Taiwan, Pyongyang, London, Jerusalem, New York-- destroying approximately three million people.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Three million people? You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: He's not. Listen to his voice.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach, he's making it up!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I understand your disbelief, Dan. When I began the plan ten years ago, my moral safeguards gave me pause at the necessary sacrifice. See, the Comedian was correct. What we were doing with the Watchmen was pointless--the savage nature of humankind would inevitably lead to the end of the world. So in order to save the world, I had to trick it--to frighten the world towards salvation with history's greatest practical joke.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: By killing millions of people? And when were you planning on doing this?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: When? Dan, my dear friend, I am the smartest man in the world--do you seriously think I'd explain my master stroke if there remained even the slightest chance of you affecting it's outcome? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it thirty minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BEAM of BLUE ENERGY SHOOTS INTO THE SKY from Karnak. Th energy infects the CLOUDS, CHARGED with CRASHING, ERRATIC BLUE LIGHTNING SPREADING out across the globe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the News vendor opens his stand--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President and his Cabinet look out the windows, up at electric blue clouds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're with the Pakistani and Indian Soldiers from earlier stopping their gun fight to look up at the sky--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (in Hindi) THIS ENDS TONIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're with the Chinese Battleships from earlier--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're with the Israelis from earlier, watching on screen-

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (in Hebrew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realization is dawning on the faces of the New Yorkers.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THIS MINUTE ON--I WILL BE WATCHING.
dialogues.text: Suddenly the SOUND of a rising, HOWLING WIND and the LIGHTNING STRIKES begin, CRASHING TO EARTH with savage, blistering force. Their expended blue energy SPREADS like LIQUID FIRE, FLOODING THROUGH THE STREETS. People SCREAM and RUN. As the LIGHT OVERTAKES the unlucky ones, they are instantly BLOWN TO ASH-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (WORLD MONTAGE): --as is the News Vendor; the Pakistani a Indian Soldiers; the Chinese Battleships; the Israeli Mis Control Room; Paris; the Great Wall of China. Destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke-filled street is silent. Then GLOWING PARTICLES COALESCE, slamming together to form Jon and Laurie, but J teleportation falters, shorting out. They FALL from the a Laurie drops roughly to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: God Jon, what was that? Jon looks around the street. Even he is awe-struck.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Interference. Cataclysmic interference. Laurie looks up and screams. THOUSANDS OF BLACK SILHOUETT are IMPRINTED on the STREET and the WALLS. Everywhere. Th is no rubble--some buildings have simply disintegrated.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Was it a war? It doesn't seem like--

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Not a war. I .don't know what it was. Dr. Manhattan looks up into the sky, studying it.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Take me out of here, Jon. Please.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. This must be very upsetting for you. I have traced the source of the Tachyon particles to Antarctica. Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Anywhere. Anywhere's better than here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL OUT FROM: The televisions--NEWS REPORTS from all ove the world, documenting the tragic destruction caused by D Manhattan. Dan turns away shaken. Rorschach boils. Adrian beams.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: God. God, he (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Impersonated Dr. Manhattan. Murdered millions of people. (re: Lynx) Call off your cat. Call off your cat and face me!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? I've ended the war-- I've ended all wars. Because of their fear of ion, I've forced the world into everlasting peace.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: By committing the biggest mass murder in history. You have no right to play God!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I wasn't playing God. Just Dr. Manhattan. Suddenly there's a LOUD BEEPING in the hall. The Lynx gro Adrian switches the monitors to the security cameras which show ion and Laurie materialize in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speak of the devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurie vomits in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Adrian, of course. Who else would have the resources

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Wait, this is Adrian's compound? Are you saying he's responsible for this-- Jon walks toward the building, entranced. Distracted.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, he killed Blake and millions of others. Excuse me, Daniel, I'm talking to Laurie ninety seconds ago

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: What, Daniel? Millions of others? Jon don't start that crap now, not here! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's these tachyons. They're, muddling things up. I'd better follow him

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: In a burst, he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon materializes in the hall. Adrian sprints like lighten out of the room, followed by the Lynx.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: No, don't let him escape!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Jon, stop him, he killed millions of people, who knows what else he'll do. Jon walks calmly after Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jon, are you okay? You seem drugged.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, he killed Blake and millions of others. Excuse me, Daniel, I'm talking to Laurie ninety seconds ago

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What? Where's Laurie?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It's these tachyons. They're, muddling things up. I'd better follow him

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Jon follows Adrian into the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon enters the MAZE of advanced technology.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Adrian, don't be foolish. Even if I can't predict where I'm going to find you, I can turn the walls to glass. The tachyons were clever but it's time to give up Jon spots the Lynx in a METAL CORRIDOR. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Very well. If I must, let us follow this through to the bitter end. ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE WALLS is Adrian, waiting by a CONTROL PANEL. He takes one last look at his Lynx.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Forgive me, girl. Jon enters the corridor with the Lynx; Adrian flicks a SWITCH. The Lynx' FUR STANDS ON END as ENERGY CRACKLES BETWEEN THE METAL WALLS. The Lynx HOWLS.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Adrian? Adrian, don't-- LIGHT BLASTS through Jon and the Lynx--both are OBLITERAT Adrian peers around the corner, winded by his success.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: You know, I really wasn't sure that would work.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN--
dialogues.text: Adrian turns. Laurie aims the prison guard's pistol at hi

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're such an asshole. Adrian cries out, LEAPS at her as she FIRES-- --and hits Adrian. He COLLAPSES. Dan and Rorschach find t as Laurie approaches Adrian's body

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Laurie, shoot him again! Adrian's hand falls from his chest to the floor, blood trickling, as his PALM OPENS-- --holding a BULLET inside.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Adrian opens his eyes and KICKS her in the stomach, sendi her flying back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: LAURIE! If you've hurt her, I'll--

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Oh Dan. Grow up. Adrian exits as Dan helps the winded Laurie to her feet. Together, Rorschach, Dan and Laurie follow him back to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian approaches his wall of TV screens when--

dialogues.speaker: DISAPPOINTED.
dialogues.text: Jon, now 100 FEET TALL, SMASHES THROUGH THE WALL. Adrian crawls desperately away, grasping for his remote on the floor. As Jon approaches him, Jon SHRINKS to six feet.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Restructuring myself was the first trick I learned! It didn't kill me before, did you seriously think it would kill me now? You are nothing but a man. And the world's smartest man means no more to me than its smartest termite! Out of tricks, out of traps, Adrian lifts the remote.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is that, Adrian? Some new, ultimate weapon?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, you could say that. Adrian goes back to his wall of screens, watching the new reports. We hear SOUND BITES and IMAGES: "India and Pakis immediately call for truce," "China stands down," "US withdraws forces," "Israel agrees on cease fire." TEARS stand in Adrian's eyes. He raises his fists in triu

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I did it. I DID IT! I've saved Earth from Hell. Next, I will elevate her to the vaulting stature of Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Next? You can't get away with this! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: No? Will you expose me, undoing the peace so many have just died for? Morally, you're in checkmate, just like the Comedian was. Jon examines the many screens, taking it all in.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I'm afraid he's correct. Exposing Adrian would only doom the world to nuclear destruction again.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He's right. All we did was fail to stop him from saving Earth.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: We we can't say anything about this

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: You're joking, of course. Rorschach walks toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach, wait a second! Let's talk this out!

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Never. Not even in the face of Armageddon. Never compromise. Adrian and Jon's eyes meet--an unspoken communication. Se this, Dan runs after Rorschach.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach! Across the hall, ion materializes between Rorschach and t exit.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Rorschach?

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Back to the Owl-Ship. Back to America. People must be told. Evil must be punished. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Rorschach, you know I can't let you do that. Rorschach pauses. Dan is halfway there . Rorschach removes his mask, tears stand in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RORSCHACH
dialogues.text: Suddenly you've rediscovered humanity? If you had cared from the start, none of this would be necessary. None of this would have happened. So what are you waiting for? Do it.

dialogues.speaker: DO IT
dialogues.text: Jon WAVES HIS HAND and BLOWS RORSCHACH APART. Dan collaps to his knees, sobbing. Jon contemplates the BURN-MARK whe Rorschach stood only seconds ago, then disappears-- --reappearing across the hall where Laurie is. She is als tears, watching all the horrible footage on the TV screen

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Laurie. I'm leaving this galaxy. For one a little less complicated.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Leaving? I, I thought you regained an interest in human life.

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: I have. I think maybe I'll create some. Goodbye, Laurie. He kisses her on the cheek--

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Jon, I'd hoped to talk to you. I've made myself feel every death, see every innocent face I've murdered to save humanity--you understand, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: Without condoning or condemning, I

dialogues.speaker: UNDERSTAND
dialogues.text: And with that, he disappears. Forever. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Across the hall, Dan recovers from mourning Rorschach. He stands, gritting his teeth. Walks toward Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: What's on your mind, Dan?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Your death.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Really. You want to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. You might have created peace, but not at the expense of justice. You need to pay for what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: That doesn't sound like you, Dan. That sounds more like Rorschach.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Exactly. Adrian readies himself. Laurie breaks away from the TV screens.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Only you're not Rorschach, are you now? How do you expect to succeed where he failed?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Tell you the truth, Adrian. I don't. Dan FLIES at Adrian, fighting like a madman for his life. His fighting style has changed. Dan's newfound brutality informed by everything he's learned from Rorschach. About justice. About life. But Adrian is the best. He takes Dan's attacks apart with ease, delivering blows which would kill a man not quite s focused on his goal. In the end, he CATCHES Dan's final strike and TWISTS. Dan's arm SNAPS easily.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Dan! Laurie charges Adrian. With one hand, Adrian blocks her attack, grabs her by the hair and SLAMS her to floor, knocking her out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan falls to his knees, bloody and beaten. Out of tricks, of time, he searches his belt for something, anything, an finds one last OWL-WING. The WINGS SNAP OUT. Desperate, h

dialogues.speaker: FLICKS IT AT ADRIAN--
dialogues.text: Who merely SNATCHES the owl-Wing out of the air. He laugh Prepares to finish Dan off.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I have to say, I've always thought your choice of an owl was quite juvenile.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Really? I've always liked owls Adrian sees that Dan has pulled one last item from his be Adrian STEPS on Dan's WRIST, bones crunching. Dan's HAND falls OPEN, revealing the OWL-SHIP REMOTE.

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: because you can never hear them coming. BEHIND ADRIAN: FLOODLIGHTS BLAZE, targeting Adrian as the SHIP CRASHES THROUGH THE WINDOW and into Adrian and Dan. Silence, but for the tinkling of GLASS falling to the flo Dan tries to stand, but he falls, his left leg shattered. Most of Adrian has been CRUSHED under the ship. He coughs fine blood spray. Adrian looks over to Dan, dying.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I . don't regret my actions. I know in my heart . I did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: So do I. Adrian lays back, calm, accepting and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sits painfully in the passenger seat, as Laurie tries pilot the ship out of Adrian's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: That's it. Careful. Now, pull the stick to the left The ship RISES and TURNS awkwardly in the hall, smashing more glass. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, the thrusters . There. She HITS THE THRUSTERS. The ship FLIES from the control r It's afterburners IGNITING the room, and Adrian's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owl-Ship RISES into the sky, the Pyramid of Karnak BLAZING from it's tip like a Roman candle. Dan watches ou the window, until his eyes slip shut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time has passed. The disintegrated buildings are being rebuilt. The shock of the attack is wearing off, and thou the streets may not be as crowded as they once were, a se of normalcy is returning. Sally Jupiter walks the sidewalk, looking for an address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally mixes herself a tall drink at the bar. Sally calls

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm okay. Thanks. We finally see Laurie now--her hair dyed, appearance chan

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom--I just want to get this out of the way . . I know Eddie Blake, the Comedian--I know he was my father. Sally freezes.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I remember. Sally downs her drink, immediately starts making another.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: It, it was years later, he stopped by out of the blue, and, and apologized. I don't know, I just couldn't stay mad. It just happened-- Laurie kisses her mother's teary cheek. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Mom. People's lives take them strange places. You never did anything wrong by me. Sally jumps as a CLICK/WHIR SOUND comes from a BOOKCASE.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Oh that's Dan. Home from "work." The bookcase SLIDES ASIDE and a blond DAN enters from the secret ELEVATOR. He is trim and confident, cheeks flushed with color. Buttoning up his shirt, he spots Sally.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Oh hi.

dialogues.speaker: SALLY
dialogues.text: Hello, Dan. Excuse me, I should clean up. Sally wipes her runny make-up, goes to the bathroom. Dan and Laurie embrace, kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Any bad guys last night?

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: There are always bad guys. Even in today's world. Slow, Laurie turns to the window. Looks out at the New Yo skyline being rebuilt.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Will it be alright? The world, I mean. He puts his arm around her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: As long as no-one ever finds out that Adrian was behind it all, the public will think ion is still up there, watching. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The threat remains, and everything should be fine.

dialogues.speaker: LAURIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just fine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A YELLOW HAPPY FACE--suddenly SPLOTCHED with RE printed on A T-SHIRT now stained with ketchup. WE PULL BACK: And find Seymour wears the shirt, eating a burger when the Editor bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: SEYMOUR! What the hell do you got for me?

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: We got nothing to write about. Everyone in the country, every country in the world is holding hands now, singing songs about peace and love--it's like we're living in a goddamn global hippie commune !

dialogues.speaker: SEYMOUR
dialogues.text: Um, I guess I can look for stuff in the crank file.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: Crank file? Whatever! Take some initiative! Run whatever you like-- Seymour turns to the PILE of submissions known as the cra file, where RORSCHACH'S JOURNAL sits on top. Seymour reac

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --I leave it entirely in your hands. --and picks up Rorschach's Journal . Just as he's about to open it, we CUT TO BLACK.
